Title: Data Analyst - (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We're looking for a Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How will you make a difference

Review the weekly metrics for each project: Analyze the main KPIs and identify potential issues and/or areas for improvement. Prepare a weekly report for the meeting with Product and Marketing.
Prepare a Quarterly Project Report with an analysis of the main KPIs.
Analyze potential ad hoc incidents.
Examine the impacts of implemented changes.
Analyze A/B Test results.
Evaluate the impact of SEO/SEM changes.

Your team

We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and that the team's success is your success, then you're one of us!

Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the office. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.

Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus.



Requirements



What will make you stand out from the crowd:

At least 3 years of experience working in Data Analysis and user flow.
Experience in e-commerce.
Knowledge of GA4 Analytics.
Experience in data management/analysis, preferably with QlikSense.
Knowledge of SQL
Understanding of data analysis/extraction (optional).
Knowledge of Amplitude (optional).



Benefits



Perks of being one of us:

Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Location

Our exceptional offices are in Barcelona's Blue Building, right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and will be able to take part in our game competitions.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

The personal data you provide will be used solely to manage your candidacy for the purposes of this position. You can exercise your rights of access, rectification, or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005. Additionally, you can email us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including documentation proving your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!

Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are an Aon company, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mentality and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what could we ask more?

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with awareness of real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company‚Äôs data model.

A typical day


Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
Democratize data through strategic data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal collaborators.
Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various collaborators that will be utilized to make strategic decisions for improvements.
Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand current problems with our existing data platform, identity solutions, and deliver high quality data foundations to data stakeholders across multiple business lines.
Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide them with visibility to real-time data on existing and new processes.


What You Need To Succeed


About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field.
Highly proficient in SQL
Experience using visualization tools, preferably Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience working in Agile environments, preferably with Jira.
Extra Credit - Exposure to data modeling and transformation tools like dbt and experience with data analysis and building data pipelines with Python.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
Hability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint ‚Äì join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues‚Äô safety at the heart of our organization.

How To Contribute To Our Vision

As our Data Analyst in PPA you research, analyze, consolidate and interpret data using statistical and data analytics methods, providing our internal customers full insight on product reliability, quality and performance, end-to-end throughout the whole value chain. Within a cross-functional team, you manage the alignment with our interfaces and stakeholders within TE and across SGRE, especially in the Business Units and the Corporate Quality function.

Mission Of The Function

PPA‚Äôs mission is ensure a robust, sustainable, and effective approach of bringing awareness on design- and product quality to the TE organization, allowing them to prioritize efforts based on business impact criteria‚Äôs and thereby ensuring SGRE can launch high quality products on the market.

Main Responsibilities Of The Position Are


Drive consolidation of product reliability, quality and performance data from various data sources throughout the value chain (manufacturing, installation, commissioning, service)
Be the focal point inside within our Technology team regarding reliability and quality KPIs, developing the technical knowledge across the product platforms
Validate and interpret data to provide context to product quality and performance KPIs, identify trends and correlations, as well as financial implications
Analyze fleet data, support product designers to identify measures to ensure required reliability
Create reports and communicate to various stakeholders (e.g. product platform managers and TE management), ensuring awareness on design- and product quality
Collaborate with data analysts in teams across the company


Position Qualifications And Required Skills


Academic degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics or similar
Work experience of 2-5 years in data analytics
International work experience e.g., as part of an international project team or working abroad including strong English proficiency
General broad understanding of- and interest in technology and underlying principles
Good communication skills are required to discuss analysis and results.


What You Need To Make a Difference


Analytical mind with a problem-solving attitude and strong communication- and project management skills
You are committed to deadlines and show ownership on your assignments
You are Team-player with a can-do attitude, open to feedback from peers and managers and willingness to learn and develop
You must be able to work independently in cross-functional initiatives with a variety of stakeholders and work effectively at all levels in an organization
You have a strong quality and result orientation


In return of your commitment we offer you‚Ä¶


Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come
A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy
Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality
Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization
Flexible working hours as well as home-office (depending on the position, legal entity or responsibilities)
Attractive remuneration package
Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more


Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions ‚Äì the greatest challenge we face.

Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Spain and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to create and manage insights and analytics solutions that turn data into powerful insights. In this role, you should have a background in data and business analysis. You should be analytical and an excellent communicator. If you also have business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we‚Äôd like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Responsibilities



Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
Build Insights reports weekly.
Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns



About You



Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
Industry experience is a must
Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) ‚Äì the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.



At .Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.

About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI‚Äîmanaged by the industry‚Äôs best and most diverse digital talent‚Äîto help the world‚Äôs trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.

Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger‚Äôs Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek‚Äôs first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek‚Äôs Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents‚Äîand resonates with‚Äîthe world around us.

While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

Title: Finance Data Analysis
Description:
About MAXAM

At MAXAM we work to offer our clients throughout the world a wide range of products and services, generating solutions, and full technical support to respond to their most specific needs.

Since our founding in 1872 by Alfred Nobel, MAXAM has grown by leaps and bounds. We are now a global company specializing in energy materials. We apply all our talent, energy and knowledge to the mining and civil engineering sectors, anywhere in the world. A lot has changed since Alfred Nobel started the business but some things haven¬¥t changed: our dedication to our people to achieve excellence in what we do.







What are we looking for?

A Junior Finance or Industrial engineer profile with data analytics skills to join the corporate team in Madrid. This position must perform the following tasks:




- Elaboration and analysis of the key projects monthly financial reporting (Sales/EBITDA, Gross margin, Trade working capital & overdues, etc.).

- Elaboration and monitoring of the projects operational KPI‚Äôs.

- Leading with Project Managers the definition and follow up of projects performance improvement plans.

- Elaboration, review and monitoring of projects Business Plans and scenario simulations.

- Modelling of processes and tools to help improve control over formulations.




Minimum requirements:

-Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Economics, Industrial Engineer or similar.

-Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.

-Previous experience in Audit Firm (Big Four) at least 1 year.

- Availability to travel.

- High level in MS Excel

- Experience with ERPs.

- Strong financial and accounting fundamentals.

- Experience in elaboration of Powerpoint presentations and experience in PowerBI is a plus.




Competencies:

Analitical capacity

Initiative

Teamwork

Pressure tolerance

Problem solving

Planning & organization




What we offer?

Permanent contract

Grow within a multinational environment

Flexible compensation package

Title: Data Strategy Analyst
Description:
Clarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing societal impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse, who believe in us and share our goals. We are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible.

We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! üìöYour work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors worldwide.

About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst that will help us continue enhancing the usage of data for the fact-based decision making processes that Clarity AI has as one of their core values and lead the lifecycle of transforming raw data into structured information üöÄ

The role provides an opportunity to join a dynamic, talented, diverse and young company, as well as be part of the team that leads Data acquisition...one of the foundations of Clarity AI value proposition ü™¥

What You'll Be Doing

Working as a Data Analyst you will be responsible for:


Gather data from primary and secondary sources, ensuring the upkeep of databases and data systems
Cleanse data and scrutinize reports and outputs to identify and rectify errors
Developing and maintaining data dashboards, charts used to support critical business monitoring
Performing ad-hoc complex data analysis using SQL and Python to support business initiatives
Conveying insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations
Collaborating with key stakeholders from the team to determine and rank the needs around forecasting and budget, as well as data collection monitoring and data sources usage
Collaborating with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done and understand data analysis requirements
Influencing key stakeholders through data analysis to establish a strong sense of collaboration towards a shared vision and goals
Identify opportunities for process enhancements



Location

The role is based in Madrid or Barcelona üåç

Way of Working: Hybrid

Requirements

What You'll Need


Mastery in data analysis languages as excel, SQL, Python skills and/or R
Demonstrated experience working with BI Tools (Tableau, Quicksight, PowerBI etc)
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact
Years of Experience: At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Educational Background: Degree in Business, Engineering or a quantitative discipline
Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative
Decisive and action-oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when they are short of information, and someone who has high energy and stamina
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)



Nice To Have


Experience in a start-up and/or tech company
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Adept at report writing and presenting findings
Additional hands-on technical experience an asset (GitHub, APIs, DBT, web-scraping)
A deep understanding of the industry and business operations is a plus



Benefits


Equity Plans - ESOP / Phantom Stock: share our success!
Annual training budget to support your professional growth
Private healthcare cover
Wellness and Fitness cover with Gympass!
Flexible Work Arrangements; We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options
Global offices across New York, Madrid, Barcelona, London, Paris, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces


More About Clarity AI ‚≠ê

Clarity AI's Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognised by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40.

Clarity AI has received several awards:


The Forrester New Wave - ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics - Leaders for 2022-2023-2024
Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023
Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023
European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020
World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020
World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela


Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!

Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are an Aon company, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mentality and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what could we ask more?

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with awareness of real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company‚Äôs data model.

A typical day


Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
Democratize data through strategic data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal collaborators.

What You Need To Succeed


About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field.
Highly proficient in SQL

Who We Are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!

Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are an Aon company, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mentality and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what could we ask more?

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with awareness of real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company‚Äôs data model.

A typical day

  • Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
  • Democratize data through strategic data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal collaborators.
  • Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various collaborators that will be utilized to make strategic decisions for improvements.
  • Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand current problems with our existing data platform, identity solutions, and deliver high quality data foundations to data stakeholders across multiple business lines.
  • Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide them with visibility to real-time data on existing and new processes.

What You Need To Succeed

  • About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field.
  • Highly proficient in SQL
  • Experience using visualization tools, preferably Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
  • Experience working in Agile environments, preferably with Jira.
  • Extra Credit - Exposure to data modeling and transformation tools like dbt and experience with data analysis and building data pipelines with Python.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
  • Hability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint ‚Äì join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues‚Äô safety at the heart of our organization.

How To Contribute To Our Vision

As our Data Analyst in PPA you research, analyze, consolidate and interpret data using statistical and data analytics methods, providing our internal customers full insight on product reliability, quality and performance, end-to-end throughout the whole value chain. Within a cross-functional team, you manage the alignment with our interfaces and stakeholders within TE and across SGRE, especially in the Business Units and the Corporate Quality function.

Mission Of The Function

PPA‚Äôs mission is ensure a robust, sustainable, and effective approach of bringing awareness on design- and product quality to the TE organization, allowing them to prioritize efforts based on business impact criteria‚Äôs and thereby ensuring SGRE can launch high quality products on the market.

Main Responsibilities Of The Position Are


Drive consolidation of product reliability, quality and performance data from various data sources throughout the value chain (manufacturing, installation, commissioning, service)
Be the focal point inside within our Technology team regarding reliability and quality KPIs, developing the technical knowledge across the product platforms
Validate and interpret data to provide context to product quality and performance KPIs, identify trends and correlations, as well as financial implications
Analyze fleet data, support product designers to identify measures to ensure required reliability
Create reports and communicate to various stakeholders (e.g. product platform managers and TE management), ensuring awareness on design- and product quality
Collaborate with data analysts in teams across the company


Position Qualifications And Required Skills


Academic degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics or similar
Work experience of 2-5 years in data analytics
International work experience e.g., as part of an international project team or working abroad including strong English proficiency
General broad understanding of- and interest in technology and underlying principles
Good communication skills are required to discuss analysis and results.


What You Need To Make a Difference


Analytical mind with a problem-solving attitude and strong communication- and project management skills
You are committed to deadlines and show ownership on your assignments
You are Team-player with a can-do attitude, open to feedback from peers and managers and willingness to learn and develop
You must be able to work independently in cross-functional initiatives with a variety of stakeholders and work effectively at all levels in an organization
You have a strong quality and result orientation


In return of your commitment we offer you‚Ä¶


Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come
A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy
Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality
Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization
Flexible working hours as well as home-office (depending on the position, legal entity or responsibilities)
Attractive remuneration package
Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more


Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions ‚Äì the greatest challenge we face.

Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Spain and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

Title: Data Analyst III
Description:
Title: Product Analytics Manager(Data Analyst III), Req# 33393952

Location: Austin,TX(Hybrid)

Contract: 12+ Month

Job Description

Product Analytics Manager

We are seeking a Product Analytics Manager to manage the analysis of quantitative and qualitative engagement data for in-store content apps.

Candidates who have an eye for data, analytics and and clear communication are highly desirable.

Roles & responsibilities


Monitor and provide reports from in-store app portfolio‚Äôs Adobe Analytics instances
Track engagement performance of app features
Understand and measure impact of the in-store apps on the customer journey
Support measurement of pilots and tests
Participate in product discovery
Participate in the facilitation of feedback gathering for customers, sales people, and partners


Requirements


SQL not required but preferred
Bachelor‚Äôs degree (MBA preferred), data science background is preferred
Background in app engagement analytics, 5+ years preferred
Demonstrated ability to be entrepreneurial and a self-starter
Advanced understanding and usage of Adobe Analytics
Ability to multitask and understand how to prioritize tasks based on importance vs. immediacy
High EQ and strong interpersonal skills
Ability to formulate budgets and financial models
Comfortable working in time-sensitive and rapidly evolving situations
High tolerance for ambiguity and complexity, while being efficient with limited resources
Level of attention to detail that is second to none


Excellent oral and written communication skills

Title: Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Progressive Leasing is a leading provider of in-store and e-commerce lease-to-own solutions. As an almost 20+ year old FinTech company that has gone from start-up to industry leader, we know how to innovate, simplify, and value all people. We are a company founded on our grit and we are constantly looking to the future. As an ever-evolving group of entrepreneurs and technologists, we strive to do the right thing period in all aspects of our work. We are a subsidiary of PROG Holdings (NYSE: PRG), an exciting FinTech holding company, with three business segments including Progressive, Vive Financial, and Four, a Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) platform.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst (Remote) to join our amazing team and help to further Progressive Leasing‚Äôs vision!

This role is a work from home position and can be performed remotely anywhere in the continental US or in our corporate location in Utah.

Employee Value Proposition (EVP): PROG is dedicated to providing people with opportunity; opportunity for inclusive collaboration, opportunity for innovation, and opportunity for development.

WE ARE: A team building Data Science and Machine Learning solutions that transform the way retailers and consumers do business!

YOU ARE: As a Data Analyst, you draw business insights from data through complex analysis, mining, and visualization. At Progressive Leasing, you will learn to understand the nuances of our business and ensure that we capture, mine, and act on data related to our customers, our stores, and our operational and financial performance to drive business impact. You will leverage strong technical skills and creative thinking to solve problems and make quantitative decisions. You‚Äôll work with cutting edge tools and products at the intersection of technology and business, and Big Data will become a way of life for you. Most importantly, you‚Äôll allow us to get unique and valuable insights that go beyond the obvious and help us achieve extraordinary results.

Your Day-to-day


Create interactive data visualizations that allow the business leaders to react quickly to performance and market trends and make data-driven decisions
Build and run models to determine optimal resource allocation
Analyze transaction patterns to prevent fraud
Extract usable information from unstructured data using advanced data mining techniques


You‚Äôll Bring


A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a technical field (Math, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Experience with data mining and visualization tools such R, Python, Tableau, and Power BI as well as querying languages (SQL, etc.)
Advanced knowledge and experience with querying languages (SQL, etc.)
Strong quantitative analytical abilities
Track record of achieving business results through creative problem solving and careful implementation


We Offer


Competitive Compensation
Full Health Benefits; Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance + Paid Parental Leave
Company Matched 401k
Paid Time Off + Paid Holidays + Paid Volunteer Hours
Diversity Alliance Resource Groups
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Tuition Reimbursement
Charitable Gift Matching
Job required equipment and services


Progressive Leasing welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Progressive Leasing does business.

Title: Data Analyst-Contract Temp
Description:
About The Role

10x Genomics is seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our Project Engineering team. The ideal candidate will have strong organization and communication skills, a strong work ethic, and the ability to collect and compile data and assist in the coordination of project execution. As a Program Coordinator, you will play a critical role in gathering and compiling data, enabling our teams to make data-driven decisions about COGS optimization initiatives.

What You Will Be Doing


Collect and analyze data to support ROI analyses of potential COGS optimization activities.
Collaborate with stakeholders (e.g., finance, procurement, planning, NPD, R&D, and Product Management) to gather relevant project-related data.
Maintain and update COGS / ROI models within the Project Engineering data infrastructure.
Provide programmatic and organization support for the Director of Project Engineering, and project technical leads.
Create reports and dashboards to facilitate the monitoring of project status and impact, and report out results to Senior Management and other stakeholders.
Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing data verification and cleaning measures, so as to ensure that the fidelity and robustness of datasets and models is adequate to support consequential business decisions.


Minimum Requirements


BS in Business or a technical or semi-technical field with 1+ years of experience either in a full time role or an internship.
Proficiency with basic data analysis tools such as Google Sheets or Excel.
Ability to work independently within a framework of guidance and specified deliverables.
Some experience with basic financial analysis and terms, though expertise in these areas is not required.
High level of attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment.


Preferred Qualifications And Skills


Experience working in a technical environment such as a semiconductor, biotech or life sciences company.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau).


#on-site

About 10x Genomics

At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It is a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world.

We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they did not even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries across biology including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience.

Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. We know that behind every scientific breakthrough, there is a deep infrastructure of talented people driving the life sciences industry and making it possible for scientists and clinicians to make new strides. We are dedicated to finding the very best person for every aspect of our work because the innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference.

Individuals seeking employment at 10x Genomics are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

10x does not accept unsolicited applicants submitted by third-party recruiters or agencies. Any resume or application submitted to 10x without a vendor agreement in place will be considered unsolicited and property of 10x, and 10x will not pay a placement fee.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Recognized as a 2024 Top Workplace by the Tennessean, EnableComp is the leading source of revenue cycle management solutions for complex claims in the US. We proudly partner with well over 1000+ hospitals across the US to help them maximize their revenue from complex claims.

Our Mission

We partner with healthcare providers to maximize reimbursement from complex claims payers by having the best people, processes, products and performance.

Our Vision

We enable healthcare providers to do what they do best.

Position Summary

The Data Analyst responsibilities will include but not limited to quantitative analysis and predictive modeling of healthcare data to provide management with statistical findings and conclusions.¬† The ideal candidate should be able to develop, collect and analyze metrics and data to formulate fact-based decisions and proactively implement process improvements through analysis of claim and operational data.




Key Responsibilities
Ability to transform complex datasets into executive-level summaries, and communicate findings clearly and succinctly
Managing multiple projects and deadlines so you will need excellent time management and prioritization skills to meet multiple deadlines
Demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking skills; strong understanding of analytics results, as well as the ability to identify a problem and develop and execute new solutions to obtain results
Effectively communicate results to key stakeholders and policy makers;¬†communication of results include clean and well-organized presentations to reflect analytic methods used and to illustrate key decision points with sufficient detail to support comprehension and replication of the analysis
Data responsibilities include identifying necessary data elements to build measures, querying data to limit large data sets, joining tables to build analytic views, other data prep, and documentation of process and results; working with external data management team to receive, load, and analyze new data
Ability to communicate with BA and IT to understand requirements, socialize ideas among peers and document work product
Solid hands-on experience and knowledge of database concepts
Ability to work independently given minimal direction
Exceptional attention to detail and work product validation, as well as the ability to step back and see the big picture
Other duties as required




Requirements and Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree
2+ years‚Äô experience with analytics, reporting, and relational databases
2 years‚Äô experience working in a healthcare, SaaS or other similar environment.
Expertise in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and SQL Server
Familiarity with healthcare terminology such as diagnosis code, CPT, claim ID, DRG, inpatient, outpatient, etc.
Experience with BI tool (Power BI/Tableau/Qlik)
Experience with statistical models and predictive analytics
Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
Must have strong computer proficiency and understand how to use basic office applications, including MS Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook).
Regular and predictable attendance.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.¬† Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




Special Considerations and Prerequisites
Strong communication and presentation skills; ability to explain complex analytic results to an audience of varying levels of technical understanding required
Exceptional attention to detail and work product validation
Strong planning, organizational, and multi-tasking skills
Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills, written and verbal
Ownership of body of work







EnableComp is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V. All applicants will be considered for this position based upon experience and knowledge, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discrimination or harassment.

EnableComp recruits, develops and retains the industry's top talent.¬† As the employer of choice in the complex claims industry, EnableComp takes pride in our continuous commitment to building and maintaining a culture centered around fostering the professional growth and development of our people.¬† We believe that investing in our employees is the key to our success, and we are dedicated to providing them with the tools, resources, and support they need to thrive and grow their career here. At EnableComp, we are committed to living up to our core values each and every day, and we believe that this commitment is what sets us apart from other companies. ¬†If you are looking for a company that values its employees and is dedicated to helping them achieve their full potential, then EnableComp is the place for you.

¬†Don‚Äôt just take our word for it!¬† Hear what our people are saying:

‚ÄúI love my job because everyone shares the same vision and is determined and dedicated. People care about you as a person and your professional growth. There is a genuine spirit of cooperation and shared goals all revolving around helping each other.‚Äù¬†‚Äì Revenue Specialist

‚ÄúI enjoy working for EnableComp because of the Core Values we believe in. EnableComp stands true to these values from empowering employees to ecstatic clients. This company is family oriented and flexible, along with understanding the balance of work, life, and fun.‚Äù¬†‚Äì Supervisor, Operations

Position Summary

The Data Analyst responsibilities will include but not limited to quantitative analysis and predictive modeling of healthcare data to provide management with statistical findings and conclusions.  The ideal candidate should be able to develop, collect and analyze metrics and data to formulate fact-based decisions and proactively implement process improvements through analysis of claim and operational data.


Key Responsibilities
  • Ability to transform complex datasets into executive-level summaries, and communicate findings clearly and succinctly
  • Managing multiple projects and deadlines so you will need excellent time management and prioritization skills to meet multiple deadlines
  • Demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking skills; strong understanding of analytics results, as well as the ability to identify a problem and develop and execute new solutions to obtain results
  • Effectively communicate results to key stakeholders and policy makers; communication of results include clean and well-organized presentations to reflect analytic methods used and to illustrate key decision points with sufficient detail to support comprehension and replication of the analysis
  • Data responsibilities include identifying necessary data elements to build measures, querying data to limit large data sets, joining tables to build analytic views, other data prep, and documentation of process and results; working with external data management team to receive, load, and analyze new data
  • Ability to communicate with BA and IT to understand requirements, socialize ideas among peers and document work product
  • Solid hands-on experience and knowledge of database concepts
  • Ability to work independently given minimal direction
  • Exceptional attention to detail and work product validation, as well as the ability to step back and see the big picture
  • Other duties as required


Requirements and Qualifications
  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree
  • 2+ years‚Äô experience with analytics, reporting, and relational databases
  • 2 years‚Äô experience working in a healthcare, SaaS or other similar environment.
  • Expertise in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and SQL Server
  • Familiarity with healthcare terminology such as diagnosis code, CPT, claim ID, DRG, inpatient, outpatient, etc.
  • Experience with BI tool (Power BI/Tableau/Qlik)
  • Experience with statistical models and predictive analytics
  • Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
  • Must have strong computer proficiency and understand how to use basic office applications, including MS Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook).
  • Regular and predictable attendance.
  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Special Considerations and Prerequisites
  • Strong communication and presentation skills; ability to explain complex analytic results to an audience of varying levels of technical understanding required
  • Exceptional attention to detail and work product validation
  • Strong planning, organizational, and multi-tasking skills
  • Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
  • Strong communication skills, written and verbal
  • Ownership of body of work



EnableComp is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V. All applicants will be considered for this position based upon experience and knowledge, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discrimination or harassment.

EnableComp recruits, develops and retains the industry's top talent.  As the employer of choice in the complex claims industry, EnableComp takes pride in our continuous commitment to building and maintaining a culture centered around fostering the professional growth and development of our people.  We believe that investing in our employees is the key to our success, and we are dedicated to providing them with the tools, resources, and support they need to thrive and grow their career here. At EnableComp, we are committed to living up to our core values each and every day, and we believe that this commitment is what sets us apart from other companies.  If you are looking for a company that values its employees and is dedicated to helping them achieve their full potential, then EnableComp is the place for you.

 Don‚Äôt just take our word for it!  Hear what our people are saying:

‚ÄúI love my job because everyone shares the same vision and is determined and dedicated. People care about you as a person and your professional growth. There is a genuine spirit of cooperation and shared goals all revolving around helping each other.‚Äù ‚Äì Revenue Specialist

‚ÄúI enjoy working for EnableComp because of the Core Values we believe in. EnableComp stands true to these values from empowering employees to ecstatic clients. This company is family oriented and flexible, along with understanding the balance of work, life, and fun.‚Äù ‚Äì Supervisor, Operations

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Master Data Management)

Sherman Oaks, CA







We are Careismatic Brands Inc., the global leader in medical apparel, footwear, and accessories. We have an outstanding opportunity for a Data Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.







The Master Data Management team at Careismatic Brands is responsible for monitoring the process of creating and maintaining a single master record for each person, place, and thing in a business. MDM helps ensure the reliability of data coming from different data sources in different formats.




This is a full-time role based in our corporate office in Sherman Oaks, CA.




Salary Range: $70,000-$75,000




Physical Demands & Work Environment

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a Team Member to successfully perform the essential functions for this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.

Hybrid role in our corporate office in Sherman Oaks.




What Your Day Looks Like

Perform regular audits of product attributes to ensure records are complete and precisely managed.
Designs and develops a framework for global Master Data standardization and governance, including owning process flows and standard definitions for governance across a variety of cross-functional systems and processes.
Assist with loading and maintenance of pricing across multiple brands.
Work collaboratively with Sales, Merchandising, Marketing, and Sales Operations to govern and maintain immaculate systematic information.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for process improvement, recommend system modifications, and develop policies for data governance.
Help troubleshoot master data-related issues regarding B2B and DTC websites.
Extract and share data from the proper system(s) as requested.
Monitoring brand sites to ensure information accuracy and proper visibility for the products.
Other responsibilities may be assigned as needed.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

BA/BS degree in Business, Business Administration, Statistics or related fields.
Proven ability to analyze data and deliver actionable insights.
Ability to create strong partnerships with key internal partners including Sales, Merchandising, Supply Chain, Production, Operations, Marketing, IT, and Customer Service.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills, with acute attention to detail, accuracy and accountability balanced with sound business judgment and decision-making skills.
Positive and go-getter team player, who can also work independently, with the ability to troubleshoot and work in a fast-moving and multi-tasking environment with numerous deadlines and across multiple cross-functional partners and seasons.
Data driven mindset to identify improvement opportunities and implement sustainable solutions.
Highly detail oriented with effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
Experience with ERP and PLM systems.
Highly Proficient with Microsoft Excel.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
Experience presenting in group settings.




What‚Äôs In It For You

401(k)
Dental insurance
Employee discount
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Life insurance
Attractive Paid time off
Vision insurance







At Careismatic Brands, we believe in the power of care. It‚Äôs the force that drives and inspires us, inside our company and out in the world. It‚Äôs why we strive to maintain a diverse and inclusive organization ‚Äì an ever-evolving imperative - where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to bring their ideas and perspectives forward.




Careismatic embraces the differences that make our organization unique. We are strengthened by diversity in all its forms ‚Äì including but not limited to race, religion, ethnicity, age, national origin, gender identity, and sexual orientation.

Title: Data Analyst - Finance (f/m/d)
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Purpose of Position

Awin‚Äôs Financial Analysts serve as a pivotal resource in shaping the company's financial future and strategic direction through expert data analysis and insightful financial modelling. This role enhances decision-making across the organisation by providing precise, data-driven insights and actionable recommendations to optimise performance and drive growth.

Key Tasks


Financial & Business Analytics Reporting: Develop and maintain reporting using Tableau to track key performance indicators, financial metrics, and other critical data points relevant to business operations
Financial Modelling: Create detailed financial models that forecast business performance and simulate various financial scenarios to aid in strategic planning and decision-making
Insight Generation: Analyse data and report outcomes to provide actionable insights that support business objectives and drive efficiency improvements
Stakeholder Communication: Present complex analysis and reports to stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner, ensuring that technical and non-technical audiences understand the implications and insights
Continuous Improvement: Continually refine and enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting processes using BI tools to better meet the company‚Äôs strategic needs.


Skills & Expertise


3+ years in a financial or business analytics position
Analytical, pro-active and inquisitive, with the ability to take ownership and deliver projects independently
The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication skills, with a proven ability to distil complex technical concepts into clear, concise explanations for non-technical audiences
Proficiency with SQL and Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau is essential
Fluency in English (C1+)


Our Offer


Flexi-Week and Work-Life Balance: We prioritise your mental health and wellbeing, offering you a flexible four-day Flexi-Week at full pay and with no reduction to your annual holiday allowance. We also offer a variety of different paid special leaves.
Flexi-Office: Do you prefer to work from our cool office, from home, or in a completely different environment? With us, the choice is yours. We‚ÄØoffer the flexibility to work wherever you want‚ÄØwithin our Awin locations.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Health & Well Being: With our support and access to various initiatives and sports offers, you can devote yourself to your mental and physical well-being.
Development: We‚Äôve built our extensive training suite Awin Academy to cover a wide range of skills that nurture you professionally and personally, with trainings conveniently packaged together to support your overall development. You can also improve your English skills by participating in our local language course.
Remote Working: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program and show your appreciation‚ÄØfor‚ÄØcolleagues who have gone‚ÄØthe extra mile‚ÄØto support‚ÄØyou.


Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we‚Äôve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‚ÄòLife @ Awin‚Äô hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world‚Äôs leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

Title: Data Analyst/Data Scientist - Project & Portfolio Management
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta Crop Protection is a leader in agricultural innovation, bringing breakthrough technologies and solutions that enable farmers to grow productively and sustainably. We offer a leading portfolio of crop protection solutions for plant and soil health, as well as digital solutions that transform the decision-making capabilities of farmers. Our 17,900 employees serve to advance agriculture in more than 90 countries around the world. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Basel, Switzerland, and is part of the Syngenta Group.

Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.

Job Description

Syngenta Crop Protection Project and Portfolio Management (CPD PPM) is seeking a passionate and skilled Data Analyst/Scientist to join our dynamic Digital & Analytics team. This is a hybrid Data Analysis/Data Science role in which you would be at the forefront of data-driven project & portfolio management, driving strategic decision-making and maximizing value creation.

As a specialist in the PPM team, you will play a pivotal role in generating insights through portfolio data management and analysis, developing models based on historical data, and enabling scenario testing for predicted outcomes. You will support the use of portfolio and project management tools, improve data quality, and extract additional value from diverse data sources. Additionally, you will contribute to digital transformation, exploring new technologies and innovating data capture and analysis methodologies.

If you are driven by the prospect of developing and supporting descriptive and predictive portfolio analytics workflows, collaborating with global stakeholders, and continuously improving data-analysis methods, this role is for you. Join us in shaping the future of sustainable and value-driven portfolio management at Syngenta.

What are we looking for?


Degree qualified or equivalent experience in a relevant field (STEM, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, IT etc.).
Experience in Project and Portfolio management & analytics, preferably within a related industry (Agrochemical, Life Sciences, Pharma etc).
In-depth knowledge of data (advanced) analytics methods and tools (ie, QlikSense, SQL & Python), probabilistic modeling and Data Science.
Machine learning, NLP, Generative AI knowledge/experience is desirable.
A keen interest in new technology, with critical thinking and passion for cutting edge data science algorithms in portfolio analytics, with deep appreciation of the value and opportunities in predictive science and digital.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills across all levels of seniority across multiple geographies.
Fluent in English with the ability to translate complex data into added-value, business-oriented value.
Proactive with the ability to work autonomously, regularly with ambiguity / complexity / uncertainty.


Additional Information

We could consider candidates based at a number of our sites in Europe including Bracknell (UK), Madrid (Spain), Budapest (Hungary), Warsaw (Poland) or Milan (Italy).

What We Offer


Extensive benefits package including a generous pension scheme, bonus scheme, private medical & life insurance.
Flexible & Hybrid working
We offer a position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment.
The opportunity to develop and apply your science within the chemical industry.
The chance to work as part of a global team to address the current and future needs of the agricultural sector.
Learning culture and wide range of training options.


Syngenta has been ranked as a top 5 employer and number 1 in agriculture by Science Journal.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Learn more about our D&I initiatives here: https://www.syngenta.com/careers/working-syngenta/diversity-and-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst / CDP Specialist (Pharmaceutical sector)
Description:
Omega CRM Consulting is looking for a Data Analyst / CDP Specialist that would like to collaborate with one of the top global pharmaceutical companies.




The Data Enablement Specialist for the Customer Data Platform (CDP) plays a crucial role in ensuring that an organization‚Äôs data is effectively utilized and leveraged for marketing activation. This role collaborates with cross-functional teams to ensure that the right data is ingested into the CDP in a way that aligns with business needs. The specialist works closely with business stakeholders to comprehend their use cases and translate them into actionable requirements.

The role requires an understanding of data models, architecture, dataset transformations, and success metrics to support the CDP‚Äôs data infrastructure and its impact on business outcomes.

The Data Enablement Specialist for CDP also supports power users to ensure they have access to all the necessary data for segmentation and marketing activation purposes.




The main challenges of this role include:




Data Modeling and Architecture Understanding: The specialist must be well-versed in data modeling principles and understand the architecture of the CDP.
Knowledge of Treasure Data is a plus.
Effective Communication and Collaboration: Close collaboration with different stakeholders is essential for successful data enablement.
Data Transformations: The specialist should be skilled in transforming raw data into usable formats.
Success Metrics: Understanding and measuring the impact of data enablement efforts on business outcomes.
Empowering Power Users: Ensuring that power users have the necessary tools and access to leverage data effectively.
Data Readiness for Marketing Automation: Ensuring that the CDP is prepared from a data perspective to support marketing automation.




Requirements




Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, engineering or similar.
Excellent communication and project management skills.
Understand data technologies like data warehouses, databases, and data lakes.
Understanding of content, context and capabilities related to data enablement.
Understanding of data architecture and modelling linking those to business needs.
Data driven decision making. Use data for informed decision-making by collecting and analyzing relevant information.
Problem-solving skills.




WHAT DO WE OFFER




Permanent contract.
Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life.
Trainings & Certifications. Improve your skills and get the official certificate from our main partners.
Home Office.
Flexible retribution (public transport ticket, Ticket restaurant, ‚Ä¶).
Health insurance.
OMEGA in action. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention.




About us




We are a digital global company whose mission is to accelerate the business experience (BX) of its customers. In concrete terms, our 360 solutions allow business transformation and acceleration by means of technology and data applied to Customer #OmnichannelExperiences in fields such as #CustomerServices, #eCommerce, #Analytics or #Marketing. We target companies from different fields such as: #Retail, #LifeandSciences, #Manufacturing but also #Education, #NonProfit, #NGO etc. We are one of the top 3 partners of #Salesforce in Europe. Our team is composed of more than 500 people of 24 nationalities based in Spain and France, who have wide knowledge and experience that understands business processes and technology while enjoying what it does. Key to our success is the knowledge of our people. We are an innovation and Outstanding Knowledge award-winning, Salesforce Consulting Partner. Our priority is the well-being of the team. We foster a collaborative culture, involved and supported by our company values: #Talent, #flexibility, #commitment and #innovation. We bring them to everything we do. #TogetherWeGrow

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bestow

Bestow is a leading insurance technology platform serving some of the world's largest and most innovative life insurers. We are on a mission to increase financial stability for everyone. Bestow is a team of mission-driven, results-oriented individuals. We offer all employees a remote (continuous 48 only)/hybrid workplace, meaningful benefits, substantial growth opportunities, and equity.

Bestow participates in the E-Verify Program .

About The Team

The Bestow Analytics team is highly visible and dedicated, working across the entire company to create data solutions that serve both our external partners and our internal stakeholders. The team works cross-functionally using cloud technology to provide curated data products, BI solutions, and high-value deliverables. As a data analytics professional, you will span engineering and insights to improve automation and decision-making for our partners and internal stakeholders.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team

This role reports to our Manager of Analytics, and we are open to a remote employee (in the Continuous US 48)

REMOTE US

About The Role


Passionate about solving problems with data and continuously delivers valuable and positive results.
Use SQL, dbt, CI/CD, Ggithub, and Google Cloud to automate data transformation pipelines that flow to our various enterprise partners .
We use Data Visualization tools (such as Tableau) to create intuitive data products, allowing our enterprise partners to better understand their business and trust their data.
Strong communicator; not afraid to contribute during meetings with stakeholders and engineering teammates; asks clarifying questions to better understand business requirements and opportunities.
Build subject matter expertise within the insurance domain to better anticipate partners‚Äô needs.
Improve data quality through innovation and governance.
Able to collaborate with other data analysts and engineers, sharing work and cross-training others.
Maintain positivity and respect for the individual and encourage the growth and development of team members.
Strong SQL (eg: BigQuery) skills and ability to perform complex, effective, and efficient querying to extract data from cloud data warehouses
Strong understanding of data transformation and quality engineering (eg: dbt and Aairflow), and general software development lifecycle (SDLC, Agile development, CI/CD, Github).
Able to communicate about data and findings, drawing upon compelling and concise summaries and clear data visualizations (slides, whitepaper, Jupyter notebook, Tableau, Google DataStudio, PowerBI, etc.)
Creating clear documentation of designs and code changes through Github, Lucid, Jira, or Confluence.


Your Experience


2+ years working in data analytics


$95,000 - $110,000 a year

Starting compensation may vary based on geographic location, work experience, and skills.

TOTAL REWARDS

At Bestow, we‚Äôre proud to be awarded for our team members, innovative products, and culture. Our standard benefits include:

Competitive salary and equity based on role

Policies and managers that support work/life balance, like our flexible paid time off and parental leave programs

100% paid-premium option for medical, dental, and vision insurance

Lifestyle stipend to support your physical, emotional, and financial wellbeing

Flexible work-from-home policy and open to remote

Remote and WFH options, as well as a beautiful, state-of-the-art office in Dallas‚Äô Deep Ellum, for those who prefer an office setting

Employee-led diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives

Recent Employer Awards Include

Best Place for Working Parents 2023

Great Place to Work Certified, 2022 + 2023 + 2024

Built In Best Places to Work, 2022 + 2023

Fortune‚Äôs Best Workplaces in Texas 2022 + 2023

Fortune‚Äôs Best Workplaces in Financial Services and Insurance 2022 + 2023

We value diversity at Bestow. The company will recruit, hire, and promote regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, pregnancy or maternity, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. We understand the importance of creating a safe and comfortable work environment and encourage individualism and authenticity in every team member.

Thanks for considering a job at Bestow.
