Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Capacity Analyst / Data Analyst with strong Tableau/Power BI skills to support a project for one of our clients in the San Francisco/CA area.




This person will be responsible for data analysis, reporting and building Tableau dashboards for their Data Center Capacity Planning, but will also have a part in the Capacity Planning process (not just reporting/dashboards) so needs to come from a similar background. Not just heads down data/reporting/visualization.




Will be working remote but needs to be local to either the San Francisco or Phoenix areas to be able to come onsite occasionally ad hoc/for meetings. No set onsite/hybrid schedule, but able to come in when needed




This is a w2 project - Remote but must be local to San Francisco for as-needed onsite meetings, etc.




REQUIRED skills: Capacity Planning, or Demand Planning or Data Center Logistics Planning or Business Operations.




What to Expect

The Capacity & Efficiency Management team is responsible for the end-to-end planning and allocation of compute, data, storage and network capacity. We work with various teams to understand their demand to build long range forecast models, and we also work with suppliers to ensure we are able to keep pace with the growth of the business. The other side of our team also manages non-capacity related budgets for our wider organization. The Analyst in this team will create dashboards that analyze key performance indicators, contribute to the growth and maturity of our insights, and work directly with engineering teams to make system improvements to improve data processing and accessibility.




What You‚Äôll Do

Apply a product-centric approach to data and reporting, ensuring discoverability through user-friendly documentation and trustworthiness with rigorous data tests
Design, build, and maintain data sources & data models to ensure data quality, consistency, and accessibility for analysis
Collect, analyze, and present data from various sources when provided a subset of potentially unrelated data points/filters to draw conclusions
Effectively communicate data analysis to non-technical audiences unfamiliar with the domain
Recognize patterns to define gaps in the applicant tracking system and drive change at a system level with responsible parties (end users, system admins, etc.)
Ensure successful integration with downstream systems and accurate reporting to stakeholders




What You‚Äôll Bring

Bachelor's degree in data Analytics, Management Information Systems, or equivalent experience
Previous experience working with Capacity or Business Operations teams
Prior relational database experience
Proficiency in SQL and other common query languages
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Critical thinking and a first principles approach to problem solving
Ability to work autonomously, identify opportunities and provide recommendations in an ambiguous environment
Prior experience working with & understanding financial datasets and their relationships (e.g. Purchases, Invoices, General Ledger entries), preferably from Oracle or similar ERPs

Title: Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content
Description:
The Global Partnerships & Content organization at Meta works closely with the leading content creators and media entities in the world to build and grow innovative and meaningful content and community engagement experiences across a variety of product areas. The Strategy & Operations team within the Global Partnerships & Content organization is searching for an analyst to understand and quantify opportunities for delivering value to creators. This individual will leverage internal and external data sources to define program strategy, support and improve the team's process, and measure program performance for future iteration, all with the goal of helping thousands of partners meet their desired outcomes. Ideal candidate is a team player and loves breaking down problems, building solutions, delivering actionable and data-driven insights, and working in a changing environment.

Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content Responsibilities:


Develop data centric strategies to drive effective scaled programs for partners across lead acquisition, product engagement and growth education.
Work with program managers to help define strategy, create metrics to evaluate success and measure impact of outreach channels and service models for business critical early stage creators.
Analyze and rigorously measure results and make data-driven recommendations for optimization of future programs and campaigns.
Understand partner performance, collaborating with key stakeholders to inform & understand analyses by providing suggestions for best metrics to be used.
Build data pipelines, queries, and reporting from multiple data sources (internal and external) to generate partner dataset for marketing and program managers to leverage.


Minimum Qualifications:


BA or BS degree
3+ years experience with SQL (Oracle, Vertica, Hive, MySQL, etc)
3+ years experience with Python
3+ years of experience in data analytics roles
Presentation and communications experience with extracting insights from technical data sets to varied audiences


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience leveraging methods such as A/B test, matching model, Difference in Difference for causal discovery
Experience with programming languages such as R or Python to build statistical models
Experience at a consumer technology or media company
Experience in growing scalable programs for Sales or Partnerships teams
Experience working in organizations with cross functional teams
Experience working independently and a track record of taking initiative in dynamic environments
Experience to multi-task and adapt well to changing environment


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. HTML:
The Global Partnerships & Content organization at Meta works closely with the leading content creators and media entities in the world to build and grow innovative and meaningful content and community engagement experiences across a variety of product areas. The Strategy & Operations team within the Global Partnerships & Content organization is searching for an analyst to understand and quantify opportunities for delivering value to creators. This individual will leverage internal and external data sources to define program strategy, support and improve the team's process, and measure program performance for future iteration, all with the goal of helping thousands of partners meet their desired outcomes. Ideal candidate is a team player and loves breaking down problems, building solutions, delivering actionable and data-driven insights, and working in a changing environment.

Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content Responsibilities:

  • Develop data centric strategies to drive effective scaled programs for partners across lead acquisition, product engagement and growth education.
  • Work with program managers to help define strategy, create metrics to evaluate success and measure impact of outreach channels and service models for business critical early stage creators.
  • Analyze and rigorously measure results and make data-driven recommendations for optimization of future programs and campaigns.
  • Understand partner performance, collaborating with key stakeholders to inform & understand analyses by providing suggestions for best metrics to be used.
  • Build data pipelines, queries, and reporting from multiple data sources (internal and external) to generate partner dataset for marketing and program managers to leverage.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS degree
  • 3+ years experience with SQL (Oracle, Vertica, Hive, MySQL, etc)
  • 3+ years experience with Python
  • 3+ years of experience in data analytics roles
  • Presentation and communications experience with extracting insights from technical data sets to varied audiences

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience leveraging methods such as A/B test, matching model, Difference in Difference for causal discovery
  • Experience with programming languages such as R or Python to build statistical models
  • Experience at a consumer technology or media company
  • Experience in growing scalable programs for Sales or Partnerships teams
  • Experience working in organizations with cross functional teams
  • Experience working independently and a track record of taking initiative in dynamic environments
  • Experience to multi-task and adapt well to changing environment

About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Genesis10 is seeking a Data & Business Intelligence Analyst for a 12 month contract position with our client. This position is fully remote.

Summary:

We are looking for a Business and Data Intelligence Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will work with cross-functional partners and develop data foundations, data pipelines, data visualization assets and analysis to enable data-driven decision-making for the Customer Success organization. This is a 12-month contract role with a potential extension.

Primary Responsibilities:


Tool and Dashboard Development: Design, develop, and maintain data tools and analytics dashboards to automate processes and provide real-time insights into customer metrics and product usage.
Foundations and Pipeline Development: Write scalable and efficient SQL to encode business logic, and develop robust pipelines on the data stack.
Data Management: Establish robust data collection, storage, and quality assurance processes to ensure the reliability and accuracy of analyses.
Project Management: Lead data projects from inception to completion, aligning with strategic goals and ensuring delivery of measurable value to the organization.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with cross functional partners in customer success and adjacent teams to integrate data-driven insights into strategies and initiatives.
Continuous Learning and Innovation: Keep up with industry trends in data science and analytics to drive innovation and improve customer success outcomes.


Basic Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative discipline
2+ years of experience with SQL/relational databases
2+ years of business analytics experience in a medium-to-large company with demonstrated ability to navigate complex data environments and provide guidance to business leaders
2+ years of relevant industry or relevant academia experience working with large amounts of data
2+ years experience in at least one programming languages (e.g., R, Python, Java, Scala, PHP, JavaScript)
2+ years of experience in data visualization and dashboard design
Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position.


Preferred Qualifications:


MS or PhD in a quantitative discipline: statistics, operations research, computer science, informatics, engineering,
Statistical modeling project experience with regression models, tree models
Data pipeline development experience
Experience with data modeling, ETL (Extraction, Transformation & Load) concepts, and patterns for efficient data governance.
Experience on a / adjacent to a Business Intelligence team
Self-starter, able to work independently but ask for guidance when needed
Ability to speak comfortably in a variety of settings including one-on-one and in front of large groups and adapt communication style for different audiences.


Suggested Skills:


SQL (Intermediate or advanced)
Data Program Management
Data Visualization and Dashboard Design


The hourly pay rate range for this position is $49.21 to $58.05

If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!

Genesis10

Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals.

For contract roles, Genesis10 offers the benefits listed below. If this is a perm-placement opportunity, our recruiter can talk you through the unique benefits offered for that particular client. Benefits of Working with Genesis10:


Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years.
The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years.
Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.)
Behavioral Health Platform
Medical, Dental, Vision
Health Savings Account
Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness & Accident)
Voluntary Term Life Insurance
401K
Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities)
Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF)
Remote opportunities available


For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website.

Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Data Analyst - 25564
Description:
CEIs Fortune 500 Client is a national leader in multi-department stores, and they are adding a Data Analyst to their team in Cincinnati.




12-month contract position with potential for extension and permanent conversion
Hybrid Position working 3 days onsite in Downtown Cincinnati (Mon, Tues, & Wed)
Pay Range of $40-$45 / HR + benefits (medical, dental, vision, and 401k)




Responsibilities:




Analyzing and generating reports on in-stock inventory, processes and ordering/buying trends
Comparing what stores ordered vs what their internal systems suggested they order- both outside inventory and deli/produce etc.
Analyst will be pulling and analyzing data in Azure/SQL Databases with a focus on data cleansing.
Leverage Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to build and maintain custom reports and dashboards to reveal trends and correlations in large data sets.
Identify opportunities to enhance reporting capabilities and improve processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the data needs to execute department and enterprise-wide strategic objectives and initiatives.
Identify and communicate any data-related issues and recommendations to the business owner, manager, and the team.
Provide data insights and solutions to leaders to drive decision-making.




Required Skills:




Must have 2 years of data analysis experience utilizing R or Python (ie. data cleansing, performing calculations on large datasets, performing exploratory data analysis or similar experience)
Power BI experience is required (Almost all of the data reporting is done in Power BI).
Basic understanding of SQL Querying is required.
Ideal candidate has experience working with some of the following: Retail Data, Process improvement, or Supply Chain data.
Associate degree in related field or relevant experience.







As a trusted technology partner, CEI delivers solutions that help our customers transform their business and achieve meaningful results. From strategy and custom application development through application management - our technology and digital experience services are tailored to meet each unique need of our customers. Our staffing solutions bring specialized skills to complement our customers' workforce and project requirements.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
We are a high energy team of product driven operators - who love to move fast. We are a flat organisation where the best idea wins and enjoy quick decision-making. We value human connection, kindness and the desire to constantly improve ourselves.¬†




Honei is redefining the dining experience through the most powerful solution to order & pay in restaurants and is already leading the Spanish market within one year of launch. Our platform is swiftly becoming the central hub for restaurant front-office operations and the primary channel for all hospitality payments. Our vision extends beyond payments, and over the next few quarters we are preparing to be the first company to digitise the restaurant end-customer journey at scale.¬†




Role: Data Analyst Intern

Location: Barcelona¬†

Start Date: Immediate




ü´±üèº‚Äçü´≤üèº You are responsible for‚Ä¶

Understanding the data structure of the company across sales, account management and business operations
Exposure to SQL, advanced Google sheets and Looker is appreciated
Creating and managing the data pipelines across NoSQL, Looker and Google Drive and sheets
Creating autonomous dashboards and automations that scale with time and create mechanisms to highlight potential opportunities and detractors using various integrations with Notion, Slack, Zapier, etc.
Run insightful ad-hoc analysis as the business needs and package insights into actions
Being the first person on the team, you are going to influence recruiting




üíº You are‚Ä¶

You are a self-starter, hands on and are will to learn, unlearn and relearn. You are curious and are always excited by the potential to learn new things.
You have learning or basic experience in data analysis. Exposure to tools like advanced google sheets, python, looker is a plus.
You are aware of the fundamentals of MongoDB (not a must)
You are keen and have some exposure in high-growth startups, established marketplace companies, or online grocery chains is a plus but not mandatory
Native level of Spanish and basic business proficiency in English is mandatory. Catalan is a plus.
Ability to work collaboratively across teams.




üéØ Your benefits‚Ä¶

High personal and professional growth opportunities
Direct exposure to C-suite internally and externally with some of the top executives of the industry
Work in one of the best offices in Barcelona with unlimited drinks
Great team culture and monthly get-togethers




üóìÔ∏è Your interview process‚Ä¶

1. Interview with recruiting manager (30‚Äô): Here we would love to learn more about you, your experience and motivation to join Honei. And also why Honei, why not some other early stage company? Pre-reads and research are always a plus.

2. Interview with our COO (45‚Äô): Here the conversation will get more technical, and we will get deeper into your experience. We may give you on-spot problems to evaluate your thinking process.¬†

3. Cultural fit with CEO (30‚Äô)




We are a driven team - who likes to move fast and get things done. Come join us if you feel strongly that you fit this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

About Our Organization:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world‚Äôs largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America‚Äôs largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor‚Äôs Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About the Team: Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

Position Overview

Dow Jones is seeking a talented Data Analyst with expertise in Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to join our B2C data team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, a passion for data-driven decision-making, and a deep understanding of digital analytics. This role will be instrumental in leveraging GA4 & other sources of marketing, web, & app data to create a cohesive set of reports and dashboards usable by a variety of stakeholders. This position will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Utilize Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to track, measure, and analyze key performance metrics across various digital marketing channels, including but not limited to website traffic, user behavior, campaign performance, and conversion rates.
Ensure data quality. Prioritize and execute best practices to ensure data validation, integrity, and accuracy across various analytical tools and processes, including GA4, Adobe Analytics, and other data solutions.
Combine multiple data sources such as Google Campaign Manager, GA4 and others to provide holistic reporting and deeper insights into marketing programs.
Develop and maintain daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboards and build new dashboards or custom reports using GA4, or other approved data visualization tool leveraging BigQuery and our Data Lakes.
Conduct in-depth analysis of web & app data and marketing initiatives to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, across Marketing, Technology, and Product to support marketing and product initiatives with available data.
Work with technical teams to implement and manage data layer and data tags to meet marketing and analytics needs, ensuring they provide consistent and reliable data sources.
Assist our data engineering team in conjunction with our data teams to help classify our data architecture for use with various reporting and database tools.
Be a steward of our data governance and data privacy requirements; erring on validation with key stakeholders first to ensure accuracy of data is provided, reduce misinterpretation of data, and prevent misuse or dissemination of sensitive data.
Document and make transparent to stakeholders the data quality, sources, and methodology and requirements of projects delivered.
Provide training and support to internal stakeholders on how to effectively utilize GA4 and interpret marketing analytics data to drive business results.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in digital analytics and GA4, and proactively recommend innovative approaches to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting capabilities.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
Previous Experience in web/app analytics, with a focus on Google Analytics (GA4 experience preferred).
Proficient in SQL for data analysis, with a strong understanding of fundamentals, proficient in writing optimized queries, managing datasets, and leveraging advanced features for efficient data solutions.
Experience with statistical software (such as Excel, SPSS, SAS), data analysis languages including SQL, Python, and R, and data visualization tools such as Looker and Tableau.
Knowledge of Google Campaign Manager and Display & Video 360 (DV360) preferred
Experience with audience segmentation/management platforms (CDP, CRM, etc) preferred
Strong understanding of digital marketing principles, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and content marketing.
Knowledge of tag management tools, such as Tealium, Google Tag Manager preferred.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and a demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. Business Area: Dow Jones - Experience - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Req ID: 42409
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

About Our Organization:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world‚Äôs largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America‚Äôs largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor‚Äôs Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About the Team: Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

Position Overview

Dow Jones is seeking a talented Data Analyst with expertise in Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to join our B2C data team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, a passion for data-driven decision-making, and a deep understanding of digital analytics. This role will be instrumental in leveraging GA4 & other sources of marketing, web, & app data to create a cohesive set of reports and dashboards usable by a variety of stakeholders. This position will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

Key Responsibilities

  • Utilize Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to track, measure, and analyze key performance metrics across various digital marketing channels, including but not limited to website traffic, user behavior, campaign performance, and conversion rates.
  • Ensure data quality. Prioritize and execute best practices to ensure data validation, integrity, and accuracy across various analytical tools and processes, including GA4, Adobe Analytics, and other data solutions.
  • Combine multiple data sources such as Google Campaign Manager, GA4 and others to provide holistic reporting and deeper insights into marketing programs.
  • Develop and maintain daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboards and build new dashboards or custom reports using GA4, or other approved data visualization tool leveraging BigQuery and our Data Lakes.
  • Conduct in-depth analysis of web & app data and marketing initiatives to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, across Marketing, Technology, and Product to support marketing and product initiatives with available data.
  • Work with technical teams to implement and manage data layer and data tags to meet marketing and analytics needs, ensuring they provide consistent and reliable data sources.
  • Assist our data engineering team in conjunction with our data teams to help classify our data architecture for use with various reporting and database tools.
  • Be a steward of our data governance and data privacy requirements; erring on validation with key stakeholders first to ensure accuracy of data is provided, reduce misinterpretation of data, and prevent misuse or dissemination of sensitive data.
  • Document and make transparent to stakeholders the data quality, sources, and methodology and requirements of projects delivered.
  • Provide training and support to internal stakeholders on how to effectively utilize GA4 and interpret marketing analytics data to drive business results.
  • Stay current with industry trends and best practices in digital analytics and GA4, and proactively recommend innovative approaches to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting capabilities.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
  • Previous Experience in web/app analytics, with a focus on Google Analytics (GA4 experience preferred).
  • Proficient in SQL for data analysis, with a strong understanding of fundamentals, proficient in writing optimized queries, managing datasets, and leveraging advanced features for efficient data solutions.
  • Experience with statistical software (such as Excel, SPSS, SAS), data analysis languages including SQL, Python, and R, and data visualization tools such as Looker and Tableau.
  • Knowledge of Google Campaign Manager and Display & Video 360 (DV360) preferred
  • Experience with audience segmentation/management platforms (CDP, CRM, etc) preferred
  • Strong understanding of digital marketing principles, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and content marketing.
  • Knowledge of tag management tools, such as Tealium, Google Tag Manager preferred.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and a demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

Req ID: 42409

Title: Global Data Analyst
Description:
Who We are

Our mission is to ‚Äúmake the healthcare experience more human‚Äù. Docplanner is a SaaS tool for doctors and clinics used to optimize their patient flow, reduce no-shows, and digitize their practices to be able to spend more time with the patient. We also operate marketplace-websites in 12 countries which serve 62 million patients monthly to easily find the right doctor and book an appointment. Only last month 5 mln medical visits were booked via our websites. That makes us the world's leading marketplace connecting doctors and patients. We have been growing rapidly and are on a path to reach EUR 0.5 bln in ARR in the next 3-5 years!

Docplanner was founded in 2012 in Poland. Our team now numbers over 2000 people based across 9 offices in Warsaw, Munich, Barcelona, Istanbul, Rome, Mexico City, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro and Bologna. It is backed by leading venture capital funds including Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Private Capital, and One Peak Partners, raising a total of ‚Ç¨130 million to date.

‚ÄúCulture eats strategy for breakfast‚Äù according to Peter Drucker. We believe in that. We‚Äôre looking for exceptional people who can help us change the world while building an amazing company. One of those is the Global Data Analyst, Sales Operations.



Job Description



Role Overview

Join us as the Global Data Analyst- Sales within our Global Sales Operations team whose main goal is to increase the Productivity of Sales and Expansion across all segments and markets. Reporting directly to the Global CSO, you will play a pivotal role in our organization. Your primary responsibility leverage data analytics to optimize sales strategies and expansion efforts. This includes conducting thorough data analysis, crafting and executing queries, developing strategic dashboards, participating in or leading machine learning projects, and evaluating A/B testing results to drive impactful business decisions.

What you will do:

Analyze and Communicate Data Insights: Thoroughly examine data sources to identify issues, interpret trends and patterns, and communicate these insights. Enhance your understanding of our database by studying other analysts' SQL queries, codes, and models.
Drive Innovation and Execution: Merge business insights with deep data understanding to develop new ideas. Execute these through writing optimized queries, calculating new metrics, building sophisticated reporting and operational monitoring systems, and creating both strategic and tactical dashboards.
Develop Machine Learning Models: Participate in the design and development of ML models, sharpening your skills in various decision-making algorithms to support and lead data-driven projects.
Lead A/B Testing Initiatives: Design, prepare, and analyze A/B tests, then communicate the results to business stakeholders to inform decision-making.


Qualifications



What will help you thrive:

3+ years of experience in data analytics or a similar role
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics is preferred but not mandatory
Excellent critical thinking, comprehension, and communication skills
Proactive, results-oriented, with a hands-on approach to problem-solving
A good excellent understanding of SQL
An excellent understanding of data analysis in Python
Experience with data visualization solutions (i.e. Tableau, etc.)
Fluent in English (verbal and written)

Extra credit

You speak one additional language amongst the following: Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, Polish
You have some experience in Machine Learning


Additional Information



Logistics

In this role, you'll be reporting to Cem Yucelten (Global Chief Sales Officer)

This is a role on the Global Docplanner Team.

Process of getting to know each other (preliminary)

1. 30' minute Interview with A√Ønhoa Hameeuw (Global Talent Partner)
2. 60' minute Interview with Imanol Goicoechea (BI Analyst) & Jos√© Ghiringhelli (Project Manager)
3. Business Case to be prepared & presented to: Cem, Jos√© and Imanol
4. References & Offer

Benefits

Share options plan after six months working with us, vesting in 5 years (subject to separate ESOP agreement and plan)
Gym membership (reduced price)
Health Insurance paid by the company
Flexible retribution plan benefits
Mental health program (iFeel)
23 days of holiday per year (on top of bank holidays, plus your birthday off on top)

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you‚Äôre reading, there‚Äôs a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we‚Äôre lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you‚Äôve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Find your place at Amaris Consulting as a Network Engineer in Barcelona. Start your new adventure in an international and agile Environment by identifying opportunities for improvement at the technical, functional, and organizational levels.




Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With a tailor-made career path, develop your skills and work on challenging projects for one of our more than 1000 clients across the globe. Being 6,350 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries you will feel part of our talented and international community. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information Systems & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences, and Engineering.




We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is in step with you to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.







üëâWHAT WILL YOU DO? üëà

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Listen to stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their needs and priorities

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Prioritize needs coming from stakeholders

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Perform functional research and design to determine possible solutions

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Construct ad-hoc financial models and analyses to support deliverables

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Perform functional testing and user acceptance testing

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Conduct data discovery and profiling for fit and gap analysis

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Tenaciously solve problems and make decisions under uncertainty

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Actively contribute to team ceremonies including: sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and retrospectives

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Demonstrate a strong ownership in understanding business needs and driving business valued outcome

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Communicate on outcomes to stakeholders to ensure understanding of progress and potential roadblocks.







üëâWHAT DO WE NEED? üëà




¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†University degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or equivalent

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†5+ years of accounting or finance experience

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†2+ years of hands on experience with SAP ECC or S/4

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Excellent proficiency with Microsoft Excel

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Comfortable writing SQL queries

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Passionate about learning everyday

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Customer satisfaction & Business oriented

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong communication skills

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience with PySpark

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Fluent in English




Preferred qualifications:

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience with AWS

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience with Databricks (or cloud-based data warehouse)







üöÄWHY US? üöÄ




We are people with dreams and motivations like you, desiring to work on projects that project us to the top and push us to improve ourselves to the best. Working next to super-talented people with whom we can share knowledge, and experiences, hang out and feel the support of our colleagues and managers. We care about our consultants, and that‚Äôs why we can offer:




Join a fast-growing global group with a turnover of ‚Ç¨565M and over 1,000 clients across the world

Be part of an international, multicultural environment of 7,750 talented people from over 60 countries and 5 continents, being able to benefit from international mobility opportunities and progress your career worldwide, and/or experience other departments and sectors.

Flexibility is the order of the day, so we have friendly remote policies, an intensive workday, as well as social benefits such as Transit, Restaurant or Kindergarten ticket, and Private Health Insurance

Explore opportunities to grow quickly with a tailor-made career path and salary evaluation: 70% of our key senior talent joined the company at entry level

Develop your skills with our Tech Academy catalogue in last technologies, access the Udemy E-learning Platform with over 500 training courses, which includes programs in interpersonal communication, team management, and project management, and participate in our Webinars and Workshops.

Choose your own training course with your annual personal budget and take advantage of our partners getting certifications paid for by the company.

Feel part of our Community by being part of our Languages sessions, Team buildings, Afterword hangouts, and the Event of the Year.

We have the We Care program, where the company aid critically affected employees.

Unlock your full potential, both professionally and personally.




Check for more opportunities on our website: https://careers.mantu.com/jobs




Equal Opportunity‚öñÔ∏è:




Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Analyst to join our IT team.

This position is available in Barcelona, Spain.

Key Responsibilities


Configure and use BigQuery
Configure and use PowerBI
Check, correct and ensure the reliability of all data
Make some dashboards for the team
Create, manage and use an ETL (Astera, Talend etc.)


Technical Stack


BigQuery
PowerBI
Metabase / MySQL
ElasticSearch


Profile

The role

The Perfect Future Team Member


Language skills: Fluent in English AND French minimum
Be proactive
Suggest system upgrades based on data
Report regularly to your manager


Why join us?


To enjoy opportunities for professional development
To be part of a supportive, collaborative & human-sized team
To evolve in a innovative environment


And above all: If you like to learn in an enriching environment with a start up spirit: then don't wait any longer to apply!

Benefits


Full-time permanent contract
Salary between 35K and 50K depending on experience
Full teleworking possible
Dynamic coworking in Barcelona / Bordeaux

Title: Data Strategy Analyst
Description:
Clarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing societal impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse, who believe in us and share our goals. We are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible.

We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! üìöYour work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors worldwide.







About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst that will help us continue enhancing the usage of data for the fact-based decision making processes that Clarity AI has as one of their core values and lead the lifecycle of transforming raw data into structured information üöÄ

The role provides an opportunity to join a dynamic, talented, diverse and young company, as well as be part of the team that leads Data acquisition‚Ä¶one of the foundations of Clarity AI value proposition ü™¥




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Working as a Data Analyst you will be responsible for:

Gather data from primary and secondary sources, ensuring the upkeep of databases and data systems
Cleanse data and scrutinize reports and outputs to identify and rectify errors
Developing and maintaining data dashboards, charts used to support critical business monitoring
Performing ad-hoc complex data analysis using SQL and Python to support business initiatives
Conveying insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations
Collaborating with key stakeholders from the team to determine and rank the needs around forecasting and budget, as well as data collection monitoring and data sources usage
Collaborating with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done and understand data analysis requirements
Influencing key stakeholders through data analysis to establish a strong sense of collaboration towards a shared vision and goals.
Identify opportunities for process enhancements




Location

The role is based in Madrid or Barcelona üåç

Way of Working: Hybrid




What You‚Äôll Need

Mastery in data analysis languages as excel, SQL, Python skills and/or R
Demonstrated experience working with BI Tools (Tableau, Quicksight, PowerBI etc)
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.
Years of Experience: At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Educational Background: Degree in Business, Engineering or a quantitative discipline
Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative
Decisive and action-oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when they are short of information, and someone who has high energy and stamina
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)







Nice To Have

Experience in a start-up and/or tech company
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Adept at report writing and presenting findings
Additional hands-on technical experience an asset (GitHub, APIs, DBT, web-scraping)
A deep understanding of the industry and business operations is a plus




Benefits

Equity Plans - ESOP / Phantom Stock: share our success!
Annual training budget to support your professional growth
Private healthcare cover
Wellness and Fitness cover with Gympass!
Flexible Work Arrangements; We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options
Global offices across New York, Madrid, Barcelona, London, Paris, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces




More About Clarity AI ‚≠ê

Clarity AI‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognised by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40.

Clarity AI has received several awards:

The Forrester New Wave - ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics - Leaders for 2022-2023-2024
Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023
Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023
European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020
World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020
World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela




Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

Title: Data Analyst - Growth
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our sunny Barcelona office as a Data Analyst. You will be working together with other data analysts and data scientists focused on creating a holistic understanding of user journeys, life cycle management and user acquisition through online performance marketing and other media. As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets. Thus, covering the full scope from data mining to reporting. In addition you will also be responsible to evangelize the usage of data via dashboards and/or other means of visualizations to key stakeholders throughout the company.

What You'll Do

Why this role?

This role is intended to strengthen the existing growth team in Product Madness and to ensure we are using the right data for the right decisions. Your key responsibilities will be to:
Work closely with other team members, data engineers and business stakeholders to ensure the data we are consuming is clean, robust and relevant.
Work closely with other team members to ensure they have easy access to reliable and relevant data in their work optimizing channels and campaigns by delivering self-service data though dashboards.
Perform on-demand quantitative analysis and reports to inform growth and/or operational strategy.
Execute and evangelize actionable insights within the team to optimise growth marketing.
Proactively work with our partners such as Apple, Google, Appsflyer etc. to ensure we maintain our ability to derive insights from the data we are provided with.
To do this successfully we believe you are:
Passionate about quantitative analysis and will have the ability to generate actionable business insights for the growth team, game teams and Product Madness as a whole.
Intuitive with regards to data interpretation, e.g. spotting anomalies without giving it a second thought.
Having a good understanding of core statistical concepts and techniques.


Requirements

What We're Looking For
2+ years work experience as a data analyst or data scientist in a similar field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Preferred experience with ETL and data engineering processes
Fluent in English


Meriting Skills
A masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a similar discipline
Experience with Python and/or R
Experience with building and tweaking attribution models
Experience with regression modelling and statistical analysis
Experience with setting up and analyzing A/B-tests
Experience from working with other F2P games, social casino titles or RMG or general knowledge about the mobile games industry or similarly sophisticated customer-facing digital businesses.
Interested in gaming and the mobile game industry


Why Product Madness?

You will be joining a global powerhouse where you will be part of a world-class talented team that creates remarkable hit games such as Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino, Mighty Fu, and Big Fish Casino. The success of these titles has led to over 400 million downloads and more than 50 million active users. But there is no stopping us there, we also have a new games team that is working on bringing new hit games to the market. Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital games division of Pixel United.

Outstanding growth has seen us build Product Madness to more than 800 team members and counting, you can join one of our seven global talent hubs including London, USA, Canada, Spain, Poland, Ukraine & Israel.

You will be part of a company that is not only Mad about games but Mad about our people. Living by our value of people first, you will feel this firsthand from the moment you step into one of our fantastic studios. This is made possible by our amazing studio experience team who help make Product Madness such a fun place to work. Be it arranging endless snacks, weekly breakfasts & lunches, lavish Christmas & summer parties, happy hour drinks, social get-togethers and so much more.

So what is stopping you from coming and joining the Madness?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world‚Äôs best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst
Description:
#hybrid-Barcelona

We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Life Science & Healthcare (Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease) therapy group in Barcelona.

The role comprises three broad functions: 1) market research and insights generation; 2) project management and execution; and 3) client service.

You will contribute Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease therapeutic expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global pharmaceutical customers. If you have passion for the dynamic oncology Infectious, Niche and/or Rare disease landscape and are excited about the opportunity to work in the market assessment field within our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You ‚Äì Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


PhD in a Life Sciences or related discipline is required, focus on Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease is preferred.
2 years of relevant experience
Knowledge of the Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease field is required; familiarity with clinical drug development, commercialization processes, regulatory hurdles and access is desired.
Ability to interpret data and insights and turn into compelling, quality narratives through a commercial lens is required, with excellent attention to detail.


It would be great if you also had . . .


Keen interest in becoming a therapeutic indication-specific expert.
Excellent project management skills (ability to handle multiple projects/tasks for self and to manage competing priorities to deadlines); shows autonomy with minimal oversight.
Demonstrated ability in problem solving, decision making and using sound judgement aligned with team and company‚Äôs business objectives.
Comfortable in handling large datasets and information from multiple sources; comfort in ambiguity with ability to develop rational evidence-based arguments.
Outstanding communication skills (written, presentation, oral) with ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and objectively in both written and spoken English.
Strong interest in engaging with customers to solve their business needs.
Has a flexible, collaborative approach to work; exudes positivity and ‚Äòcan do‚Äô attitude.


What will you be doing in this role?


Build and apply a strong understanding of disease-specific insights, including the dynamics of oncology Infectious, Niche and/or Rare disease markets, regulatory and commercial aspects of drug development and the wider pharmaceutical industry.
Critically analyze data from multiple sources (e.g., clinical trial data, commercial information, market research data) to evaluate market trends, competitive dynamics, assess opportunities and build forecasts.
Conduct primary market research via interviews and surveys with medical and healthcare experts in the oncology Infecious, Niche, Rare disease field, and secondary market research.
Write and produce high-quality syndicated (and custom) content independently or in collaboration with team members with minimal supervision, adhering to product specifications and timelines.
Communicate concisely and effectively disease-specific insights through multiple formats (e.g., business writing, slide decks, live presentations).
Field customer inquiries and ad hoc requests (internal and external) to high standard, showing strong grasp of complex clinical and commercial issues.
Interact effectively and efficiently with multiple stakeholders across the business (e.g., Commercial, Epidemiology, Support Services).


About The Team


We are an international and diverse team of 12 members (3 US based) with expertise in market research on infectious, niche and rare diseases.
The team culture is dynamic, creative, and supportive ‚Äì excellence, integrity, and care are in our DNA.
A modern culture environment combined with all the financial and stability advantages of working for a large business.


Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits


Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
30 working days of vacation.


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

What You'll Do

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve


Who You Are

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst Product
Description:
Job Description

Hi there!

We are Semrush a global IT company developing our own product a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here so don t miss your chance.

This is our Data Analyst role for those who strive to implement functional processes and drive them to full completion.

Tasks in the role


Providing product customer success and marketing teams with data and insights to successfully deliver projects
Integrating cleaning transforming maintaining and analyzing data
Delving into the data and not losing sight of the business goals and independently exploring issues and drawing conclusions
Showing practical experience in data visualization (Tableau/Data Studio)
Having a glass half full approach - think about solutions not problems
Communicating findings and actionable insights to relevant stakeholders


Requirements

Who we are looking for


Min. 3 years of experience with Tableau/Looker Studio
Good knowledge of ETL and SQL
Python knowledge or other programming language
C1/bilingual/native level of English (must have!)
Great Excel skills
Bachelor s or Master s degree in engineering computer science data science/statistics or business administration
Data automation tools knowledge (e.g. Airflow)
Experience in the practical use of statistical analysis tools


They say there are no perfect candidates but that might well be you if


Experience in creating and maintaining data integration solutions from various sources
You share our common values Trust because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves Sense of Ownership because it s not worth wasting time on something you don t believe in and enthusiasm for Constant Changes because we are always looking to make things better


A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

You will be working in the Insight team inside the Strategy Analytics team. Your direct colleagues are mainly BI developers data engineers and QA engineers.

Tools and technologies we use


Google Cloud Platform (Google BigQuery as DWH Compute Engine for servers).
Python SQL.
Tableau for visualization.
Gitlab + Airflow for code versioning and CI/CD.


We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably


This offer stands for the hybrid work format some days you work from the office and some #wfh. Trust us it s an efficient way of work. Proven!
Flexible working day start
Unlimited PTO
Hobby benefit
Breakfast snacks and coffee at the office
Corporate events
Training courses conferences
Gifts for employees


Finally a Little More About Our Company

We ve been developing our product for 15 years and have been awarded G2 s Top 100 Software Products Global and US Search Awards 2021 Great Place to Work Certification Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10 000 000+ users in America Europe Asia and Australia have already tried Semrush and over 1 000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Tableau,Looker Studio, ETL, SQL

We ve been developing our product for 15 years and have been awarded G2 s Top 100 Software Products Global and US Search Awards 2021 Great Place to Work Certification Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10 000 000+ users in America Europe Asia and Australia have already tried Semrush and over 1 000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Tableau,Looker Studio, ETL, SQL

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

What You'll Do

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Responsibilities

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).


Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology
Bonus: experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, International client.|Power BI, SQL, DAX.


About Our Client

Leading global supplier of technology and services.

Job Description


Maintenance, design, and development of reports in Power BI to provide key information to the business teams.
Maintenance and development of Power Automate flows to optimize internal processes.
Develop and optimize data models to ensure the accuracy and quality of information.
Coordination with the data engineering team to ensure data accuracy and quality.
Work with business teams to understand their reporting and analysis needs and provide effective solutions.
Provide training and support to Power BI users in the company to ensure their proper utilization.


The Successful Applicant


Demonstrable experience as a data analyst with a focus on Power BI, with solid knowledge of DAX, data modeling, and dashboard visualization and design.
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases for efficient data management.
Strong data analysis skills to interpret and effectively communicate results.
Collaborative ability to work in a team, share knowledge, and contribute to achieving common goals.
Autonomy and problem-solving skills to take charge of issues and provide effective solutions.
Education in Engineering, Mathematics, Business Administration/Economics, or related fields.
Fluent in Spanish, fluency in English will be a big plus.
Candidates must be based in Barcelona or Vigo (Pontevedra).


What's on Offer


Career progression
Learning
International environment
Work flexibility


Contact: Jordi Aluma

Quote job ref: JN-082024-6498671

Title: Data Engineer Internship (Python)
Description:
Internship Title: Data Engineering

Department: Business Intelligence

Location: Barcelona (Hybrid)

Type: Full-time (25+ hours per week)

About Us:

Rentals United (https://rentalsunited.com/) is a hot B2B travel tech company born in 2014. Offices located in Barcelona and Warsaw, and workmates spread worldwide. We help our clients - Vacation Rental Owners and Property Managers to distribute their properties onto multiple sales channels in real-time, therefore saving them time and increasing their booking rates and experience!

Transparency, Connection, and Opportunity building are the value pillars that represent Rentals United's People and Product!

We empower enterprise vacation rental property managers, PMS software partners, and OTAs to grow through efficient, reliable, market-leading channel management and other innovations. The Rentals United network consists of advanced connections to the big OTAs such as Booking.com, Airbnb, Vrbo, top-performing niche sites, and book direct websites to help businesses master marketing, gain competitive advantage, and optimize growth strategies. Join us and be part of the new channel manager generation!

We are looking for a self-driven student to join us!

If you are eager to find the best multicultural environment in Barcelona to develop your internship, you are in the right place!

We are seeking a supportive and motivated student willing to go the extra mile, passionate about helping other colleagues, and eager to learn about the Vacation Rentals Business from a real business perspective while being part of the Business Intelligence team.

Why do we want you with us?


You show a professional approach and a good understanding of the office environment.
You are not only a good team player, but you also enjoy being surrounded by international colleagues at a multicultural company.
You want to work in a team where you can learn, brainstorm and contribute with ideas!
A start-up atmosphere with frequent changes is challenging for you.
You are interested in SaaS solutions companies and e-commerce solutions.
You can provide immediate availability. This is a huge extra!
You are a business-minded student willing to optimize processes and want to learn more!



Learnings


Data processing and transformation of different types: Hubspot, Zendesk, internal data, ...
Preparation of reports and business insights.
Processes automation of repetitive tasks.
Implementation of new algorithms to improve customer retention.



Tasks


Working with open source technologies such as Python
Querying large data-sets
Coding ETL pipelines in Python and SQL
Using BigQuery and AWS environments
Liaising with managers and stakeholders within the business to communicate findings
Providing analysis and insight to drive business improvement and impact upon business decisions.



Technical knowledge


Python (high level)
SQL, ETLs



What would be a plus:


Experience with Cloud platforms (AWS, BigQuery)



What is MANDATORY for this position:


You can provide an Educational Agreement with a School/University of the EU.
Minimum 6 months length internship, with a schedule of 25+ hours per week.
High English and Spanish levels are a must.



What we offer you:


An opportunity to join one of the fastest-growing companies in Barcelona!
A dynamic and multicultural environment, with more than 18 nationalities to meet.
Hybrid-remote position, and short days on Fridays (2pm!).
Free coffee, tea, and water!
Friendly environment. We don‚Äôt understand work without a team.
Office located in one of the best areas of Barcelona, close to many restaurants and shopping centers.
Financial aid during the internship - from 600‚Ç¨ per month*
Possibility to join the company as an employee after the internship period.
Leave the suits at home - Be you at RU!
Language classes: English, Spanish, Catalan & French!
Show more
