Title: Finance Data Analyst ‚Äì M/F ‚Äì Oporto ‚Äì Open Ended Contract ‚Äì Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Finance Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC FAR DATA TEAM

‚ÄúDonn√©es FAR‚Äù (stands for Finance, Actuary, and Risk Data) Department is in charge of providing data to 3 main departments of the company : Finance, Actuary and Risk. You responsibilities will be to collect, check, and provide data from our business to our internal clients (Finance, Actuary ‚Ä¶) using automated tools.

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN THE FAR DATA TEAM


Participate in data quality audit work on a defined scope:
Participate in the administration of the necessary repositories on its perimeter
Participate in the development of the reference documentation associated with the data
Participate in the governance of data quality


As Our New Finance Data Analyst, You Must Have


Degree in Data Analysis, Finance or Actuarial
Professional background about 3/5 years in data analysis for finance/accounting functions.
Fluent in English (C1 level is mandatory)
Fluency in French (B1-B2 level would be greatly appreciated)
Excel VBA
SAS
Python
Datavizualisation Tools (PowerBi, Qlik‚Ä¶)


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more‚Ä¶


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.

The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.

Your Main Activities Are


Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
Responsible for database production and maintenance.
Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit; Counterparty; Equity; Market; Operational.
Build knowledge and easiness in the main tools and software used by the team.


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelors/MSc in Economics, Finance and Accounting
Very good communication skills
Analytical ability, attention to details, autonomy
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Proactivity
Risk management - Risk analysis
Technical skills ‚Äì R, VBA and Python

The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.





This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. Title: BI Consultant (m/f)
HTML:
We are recruiting a dynamic and qualified BI Consultant to join our team. This role offers the opportunity to work on training and developing Business Intelligence solutions. You will work directly with clients from various industries to help them transform data into valuable insights, enabling strategic decision-making and driving their businesses forward.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Business Management, or similar fields;
  • Proven experience with Power BI and Excel;
  • Knowledge of DAX, Power Query M, Excel VBA, and Python;
  • Pedagogical Competence Certificate (CCP);
  • Strong communication skills, preferably with experience as a trainer;
  • Efficient and effective problem-solving abilities;
  • Availability to travel across the country.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and attractive benefits;
  • Hybrid work model;
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development;
  • Collaborative and innovative work environment.

Application

If you meet the above requirements and wish to be part of a growing company, send us your CV and motivation letter to:

Join us and help transform data into strategic decisions!

Title: Data Analyst - Calibration Officer
Description:
Department Overview

The Calibration team is part of the RISK department and its entity RISK Global Services. This department reunites all the teams offering common services required in the management and supervision of the Bank's risk profile. The RISK Global Services teams aim to transversally develop optimized resources, platforms and common services that are adding value for all of RISK. Their activities cover transversally market, counterparty, credit and liquidity related topics. They assume their responsibilities in full cooperation with either RISK Business Domains or Global Practice teams, or else with subsidiaries or branches of the corresponding RISK teams.

More precisely, the Calibration team is part of RISK Systems within RISK Global Services. RISK Systems at Group level is responsible for risk capital markets IT systems. Within RISK Systems, the Calibration team is responsible for the regular control of the parameters used in the market and counterparty credit risk calculation processes. Such calculation processes are global in the bank (no process by region or country) and as such, the team interacts with other teams worldwide.

The function offers the opportunity to act in an international and dynamic environment with new business and regulatory requirements to cope with.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities

The candidate will be responsible for the following tasks:


To ensure regular analysis and updating of the statistical parameters used in market management systems.
To assess the impact of parameter analysis on business.
To develop the calibration process with new risk factors and updates of the risk methodology.
To meet all legal and economic requirements for sizing.
To optimize the automation and flexibility of the process.


More precisely, the candidate will be responsible for a set of calibration on counterparty risk (quarterly calibration of the PFE and monitoring of stressed periods for stressed EEPE, annual calibration of counterparty standards). She or he will coordinate with all the relevant teams to present on a periodic basis to RISK senior management and sometimes regulators the impacts of these calibration runs.

Processes rely on rigorous governance supported by procedures and meetings and on strong interactions with other teams throughout BNP Paribas Group.

Professional Qualifications / Candidate Profile‚ÄØ


Delivery-focused, with the objective to deliver added value to our customers (including Front Office).
Analytical skills, problem solving/analysis.
Strong communication skills (data consolidation, summary, documentation in English).
Fluent in English.
Proficient in Office and a good knowledge of the Python programming language is an asset.
Ability to work with colleagues from the team as well as from other RISK teams (Systems, Methodology, Reporting, Market and Counterparty Risk Analysts ‚Ä¶) and Front Office teams.


Show more

  • Fluent in English.
  • Proficient in Office and a good knowledge of the Python programming language is an asset.
  • Ability to work with colleagues from the team as well as from other RISK teams (Systems, Methodology, Reporting, Market and Counterparty Risk Analysts ‚Ä¶) and Front Office teams.

Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 6+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
Expertise on end-to-end Data Pipeline Development, ETL processes and Alteryx;
Knowledge in Data Mesh concepts (Starburst, Trino);
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala;
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases;
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Databricks, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?




Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DBServices helps to design, develop and support digital platforms for large and mid-sized companies in ITC, Banking, Retail, Government, Health, and other industries in Europe and Americas.

Tasks


Integrate into our Data Team, working together with the NY Data Office, as well as team members in Paris and Porto, to elevate Porto's expertise in this practice.
Collecting and interpreting data from various sources to identify patterns and trends, driving insights for the business.
Contribute to local initiatives and projects, from assessment and use case identification to data preparation, implementation, and industrialization.
Work closely with business users to understand their requirements and challenges regarding data analytics, data reconciliation, and Power Platform solutions.
Translate business requirements into a data workflow, dashboards, and application solutions utilizing Alteryx and Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Collaborate with business analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and developers to deliver comprehensive solutions.
Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary deliver the data and power platform projects.
Drive insights to answer business questions with data and visualizations, transforming data into actionable insights.
Ensure the maintenance and evolution of created assets throughout the project lifecycle.



Requirements


Over 5 years of experience in data management, analytics, and visualization tools.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in creating data workflows, including data preparation and reconciliation, using Alteryx or comparable data analytics tools such as Dataiku or Knime.
Experience with Business Intelligence and data visualization tools, particularly Power BI.
Capability to develop and maintain solutions using Power Apps and Power Automate.
Strong knowledge of SQL.
Enthusiasm for learning about new technologies, including Power Platform and Dataiku.
Genuine passion for continuous improvement, innovation, and assisting others.
Willingness to travel internationally for short durations as needed.
Previous experience in the financial sector is highly advantageous.
Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban) is an asset.
Proficient in English, with a minimum level of B2.
Proficiency in French is highly desirable.



Benefits

At DBSPT you will find:

A collaborative environment, with sense of community

The opportunity to meet people from different countries and cultures;

Personal and professional development program with full access to the Alura courses platform.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At KWAN, we don‚Äôt just offer jobs ‚Äì we provide platforms for Building a Bright Future. We work with a wide range of technologies, and can align your unique skills, passions, and professional background to place you in a project that matters. Growth is very important in

KWAN, and we will guide you throughout your career journey, with an entire team of dedicated People Managers.

Currently, we are seeking a Data Analyst who‚Äôs eager to continuing to evolve, thrives on challenges, and is ready to embark in a new opportunity.


üíº Responsabilities:

  • Responsible for analysis, developments, tests and integration of technologies to serve business intelligence projects within the perimeter (BI & Analytics);
  • Align application code to the best technical and methodological practices requested by the entity on the perimeter;
  • Coordination with Production teams to create self-service environments for Self Service projects and manage releases;
  • Ensure maintenance and level 3 support of our scope of applications;
  • Experience in Agile context (like Kanban, Lean or SCRUM).


üë®‚Äçüíª Requirements:

  • Solid knowledge and 2 years of experience in reporting and ETL development with Power BI and Alteryx;
  • SQL development skills;
  • PL/SQL development skills;
  • Nice to have: SAP Business Objects, Jaspersoft, VBA, API, Python, Tibco Spotfire.
  • English (read, spoken, written ‚Äì B2 level or superior).


üåü Offer:

  • Empowering and respectful work culture where every voice matters;
  • Personalized Coaching Program: Provided by in-house specialists, our People Managers
  • Continuous Learning: Join our tech meetups and online trainings;
  • Dynamic Community Culture: From movie and quizz nights to dinners and our annual summer gathering, we believe in having fun together;
  • Celebrating You: Through our Rocket Points Employee Rewards System, we constantly recognize your contributions.


If this offer resonates with your career aspirations and you‚Äôre ready to embrace an exciting new challenge, we encourage you to seize this opportunity.


Not sure yet? No problem! Reach out anyway, and let our team guide you through the best opportunities we have for you. üöÄ

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a project of international scope, with a client that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an international project in the banking sector.

üí° What We're Looking For

  • Solid knowledge and experience in reporting and ETL development with Power BI and Alteryx;
  • SQL development skills;
  • PL/SQL development skills;
  • Nice to have:
    • SAP Business Objects;
    • Jaspersoft;
    • VBA;
    • API;
    • Python;
    • Tibco Spotfire.
    • Autonomous, organized and delivery-focused with attention to detail;
    • Work well with multicultural teams and locations;
    • Ability to work well under pressure and tight timeframes;
    • Good work ethic and high levels of motivation;
Language Skills:

  • English (read, spoken, written - C2 level minimum);
  • French knowledge is a nice to have.

‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DA/AT/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.


Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.


What are we looking for? Data Engineer


What you will be doing:


  • Check environments, analyze issues, find root cause and fix or lead the fix with other teams;
  • Develop/Maintain ETL Pipelines in Informatica PowerCenter;
  • Develop/Maintain Shell Script batches;
  • Respond to requests from BPCE and other stakeholders;
  • Ensure rotative support for monthly and quarterly closings;
  • Ensure quality development and non-regression.


Need to have:


  • High degree in Computer Science (or equivalent);
  • ETL experience (preferably PowerCenter Informatica);
  • Oracle Database, PL/SQL;
  • Shell Script;
  • UNIX/LINUX;
  • Experience with Version Control (Git, other)
  • Good English level is mandatory
  • 2x onsite



Do you accept the challenge of coming with us?


We are KCS: We konnect. We unite. We kommunicate.


We fight to offer better services. To go further every day. Together.


Connected. As K. As ONE.

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì M/F - Oporto ‚Äì Open Ended Contract ‚Äì Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC RSBI TEAM

As a Technical expert / administrator of Data Visualization et Data Preparation solution, you will have to ensure the functioning of existing Dashboards (based on DataViz solutions) et Data preparation tools, and develop new ones for Finance and Actuarial needs

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN RSBI TEAM


Create and maintain DataPrep wokflow / tools (Alteryx / Dataiku)
Modeling and development of dashboards within PowerBi and Tableau technologies
Write functional and/or technical documentation and create POCs (Proof Of Concept)
Ensure diagnostics and resolution of malfunctions
Participate to the implementation process improvements
Manipulate data to facilitate decisions by Finance teams


As Our New Accounting Analyst, You Must Have


Information systems background
Professional background about 2/3 years in a similar position
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling
Data Preparation workflow modeling (Dataiku and Alteryx)
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling (DMC)
Data Visualization / Restitution tools (mainly Tableau and Power BI)
Be fluent in English (B2/C1 level) and French (B2 level) ‚Äì mandatory


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more‚Ä¶


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills


  • Minimum of 3 years' experience in a similar role;
  • Experience in Python, Tableau and/or Power BI, SQL queries and a good understanding of database architecture;
  • Knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Airflow and Prest;
  • Fluent English.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Luxclusif is a technology-driven global B2B platform founded in 2013. Luxclusif became part of Farfetch in 2021, offering 360¬∫ resale solutions for the luxury fashion industry shaping the future of pre-owned offers for customers, brands and retail partners and other suppliers of pre-owned products. Based in Porto, Luxclusif provides a wide range of services, implementing unique, end-to-end customized solutions based on resale data.

PORTO

Our office is near Porto, in the north of Portugal, and is located in a vibrant business hub. It offers a dynamic and welcoming environment where our employees can connect and network with a large community of tech professionals.

What You'll Do


Apply problem-solving capabilities to understand the business issues/requirements and then suggest a suitable approach from an analytics perspective
Gather business knowledge and its processes to challenge new approaches, and trends and enhance the synergy of solutions and processes within Luxclusif
Act as the preferential interface for the business units regarding the development of new analytical solutions along with business process improvements
Define, along with the business areas, the project requirements, outlining goals, scopes, benefits, stakeholders, and approach
Developing and arguing on business cases for the most relevant features, managing relationships and expectations
Guarantee, together with the project teams, the project implementation and the respective change management and adoption, to fulfill the desirable results
Be one of the go-to persons for analytical transformation initiatives within the company


Who You Are


You have a Computer Science, Information Systems degree or equivalent specialized training/certification
You have at least 5+ years of experience in the role or similar and proven experience with data analytics
Strong skills in Postgres, SQL Server, and MySQL for data querying and manipulation
Experience in developing and maintaining interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI and Looker
Familiarity with Databricks for big data processing and analytics.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, scripting, and automation tasks.
Structured, with analytical and conceptual capabilities;
High levels of dynamism, communication skills, and interpersonal relationship skills
Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline-driven atmosphere
Proficiency in English


Rewards & Benefits


Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program


EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT


Luxclusif is committed to being an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is celebrated. We make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances. If you require special accommodation, please let us know.

Title: BI Consultant (m/f)
HTML:
We are recruiting a dynamic and qualified BI Consultant to join our team. This role offers the opportunity to work on training and developing Business Intelligence solutions. You will work directly with clients from various industries to help them transform data into valuable insights, enabling strategic decision-making and driving their businesses forward.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Business Management, or similar fields;
  • Proven experience with Power BI and Excel;
  • Knowledge of DAX, Power Query M, Excel VBA, and Python;
  • Pedagogical Competence Certificate (CCP);
  • Strong communication skills, preferably with experience as a trainer;
  • Efficient and effective problem-solving abilities;
  • Availability to travel across the country.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and attractive benefits;
  • Hybrid work model;
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development;
  • Collaborative and innovative work environment.

Application

If you meet the above requirements and wish to be part of a growing company, send us your CV and motivation letter to:

Join us and help transform data into strategic decisions!

Title: Data Analyst - Calibration Officer
Description:
Department Overview

The Calibration team is part of the RISK department and its entity RISK Global Services. This department reunites all the teams offering common services required in the management and supervision of the Bank's risk profile. The RISK Global Services teams aim to transversally develop optimized resources, platforms and common services that are adding value for all of RISK. Their activities cover transversally market, counterparty, credit and liquidity related topics. They assume their responsibilities in full cooperation with either RISK Business Domains or Global Practice teams, or else with subsidiaries or branches of the corresponding RISK teams.

More precisely, the Calibration team is part of RISK Systems within RISK Global Services. RISK Systems at Group level is responsible for risk capital markets IT systems. Within RISK Systems, the Calibration team is responsible for the regular control of the parameters used in the market and counterparty credit risk calculation processes. Such calculation processes are global in the bank (no process by region or country) and as such, the team interacts with other teams worldwide.

The function offers the opportunity to act in an international and dynamic environment with new business and regulatory requirements to cope with.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities

The candidate will be responsible for the following tasks:


To ensure regular analysis and updating of the statistical parameters used in market management systems.
To assess the impact of parameter analysis on business.
To develop the calibration process with new risk factors and updates of the risk methodology.
To meet all legal and economic requirements for sizing.
To optimize the automation and flexibility of the process.


More precisely, the candidate will be responsible for a set of calibration on counterparty risk (quarterly calibration of the PFE and monitoring of stressed periods for stressed EEPE, annual calibration of counterparty standards). She or he will coordinate with all the relevant teams to present on a periodic basis to RISK senior management and sometimes regulators the impacts of these calibration runs.

Processes rely on rigorous governance supported by procedures and meetings and on strong interactions with other teams throughout BNP Paribas Group.

Professional Qualifications / Candidate Profile‚ÄØ


Delivery-focused, with the objective to deliver added value to our customers (including Front Office).
Analytical skills, problem solving/analysis.
Strong communication skills (data consolidation, summary, documentation in English).
Fluent in English.
Proficient in Office and a good knowledge of the Python programming language is an asset.
Ability to work with colleagues from the team as well as from other RISK teams (Systems, Methodology, Reporting, Market and Counterparty Risk Analysts ‚Ä¶) and Front Office teams.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Being part of the Data & Analytics (D&A) Market Europe team will focus on delivering business value for the European Market and its various stakeholders, enabling access to the right data and optimising performance through Data Analytics and Insights. The purpose of this role is to explore various internal and external data sources, integrate those data sources, prepare data for consumption in a data lakehouse and work in visualizing data with Analytics tools. This will happen by creating an integrated analytical data model connecting the dots between global and local data sources

WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

  • Being part of our team that delivers unseen Insights generated from Data using Visualization tools like Power BI or Microstrategy;
  • Creating the data backbone powering Analytics and Machine Learning solutions that put decision-making on the next level;
  • Working in the latest technologies such as Spark, Delta Lake, Airflow, Python, Kafka etc.;
  • Use of Databricks to work in a Lakehouse Data Mesh concept;
  • Being in touch with senior technical stakeholders, and business functions from Europe Market (Finance, Wholesale/Retail, Demand Planning, Brand Merchandizing, GOPS);

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • A developer able to create state-of-the-art data applications using Python and SQL;
  • A developer with Good data visualization skills e.g. Power BI, Microstrategy, Tableau, matplotlib, plotly or something similar.
  • Knowledge in cloud platforms, data modeling, both batch, and streaming workloads, and databases;
  • +4 years of hands-on data engineering experience;
  • Experienced in software engineering best practices (design patterns, test-driven development, and clean code);
  • Experienced in Agile/Scrum methodologies and collaboration with cross-functional teams;
  • Understanding of Spark internals; Knowledge of data platforms such as Databricks would be a plus;
  • Fluency in English (mandatory).

WHAT ARE WE OFFERING?

  • Competitive salary and benefits;
  • Hybrid work policy and flexible working hours;
  • Sports and work-life balance incentives;
  • Upskilling and internal growth (local and international);
  • International and diverse work environment;
  • State-of-art office space and conditions.

Candidates must be currently located in Portugal and already be eligible to take on full-time employment. Only applications with an English CV will be considered.

Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 6+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
Expertise on end-to-end Data Pipeline Development, ETL processes and Alteryx;
Knowledge in Data Mesh concepts (Starburst, Trino);
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala;
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases;
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Databricks, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?




Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
THE TEAM


The Global Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.
The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.
Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.
We seek to shape the technologies available to the client‚Äôs needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.


Responsabilities


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends throught what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understading their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving skills.
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stekeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders.
You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges.


Mandatory Experience And Knowledge


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analysze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus

Title: Data Engineer (Cloud Technologies)
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
At Sogrape we are embarking on a transformative data journey, and we're looking for a talented Data Platform Engineer to join our team. Be part of our data transformation journey as the Data Platform Engineer. You'll oversee the implementation of a cloud-based data platform, from design to deployment. Your role will involve architecting scalable solutions, integrating diverse datasets, and optimizing platform performance. This project offers the opportunity to shape our organization's data infrastructure and drive valuable insights.




We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer to join our team and take the lead in building data pipelines using cloud technologies. If you're skilled in cloud technologies and passionate about data-driven solutions, join us in this impactful project! Do you have what it takes?




Your main responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines in cloud environments, utilizing technologies such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data requirements and implement effective solutions that meet business needs
Optimize data processing and storage for performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency
Ensure data integrity and security throughout the pipeline, adhering to best practices and compliance standards
Ensure best data modelling and transformation practices
Stay updated with the latest advancements in cloud technologies and data engineering practices, continuously improving our data infrastructure




What we are looking for:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a Data Engineer, with a focus on building data pipelines in cloud environments
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Proficient in structured query languages
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and services, such as AWS (App Flow, S3, EC2, Glue, Lambda), Azure (Data Factory), or Google Cloud (Dataflow, BigQuery)
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and data modeling techniques
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment




What we have to offer:

Work with a specialized team in a global family wine company with a strong international presence in more than 120 markets
Hybrid working model and additional vacation days
Exclusive access to our top-quality wines and great brands
Exclusive access to wine tourism experiences at our properties
Specialized wine training at the Sogrape Wine Academy
Health Insurance, Sogrape Pension Plan, Flexible Benefits Plan, and wellness initiatives
Professional development opportunities




Apply now to be part of our exciting journey!

Be part of our data transformation journey as the Data Platform Engineer. You'll oversee the implementation of a cloud-based data platform, from design to deployment. Your role will involve architecting scalable solutions, integrating diverse datasets, and optimizing platform performance. This project offers the opportunity to shape our organization's data infrastructure and drive valuable insights.


We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer to join our team and take the lead in building data pipelines using cloud technologies. If you're skilled in cloud technologies and passionate about data-driven solutions, join us in this impactful project! Do you have what it takes?


Your main responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines in cloud environments, utilizing technologies such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data requirements and implement effective solutions that meet business needs
  • Optimize data processing and storage for performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency
  • Ensure data integrity and security throughout the pipeline, adhering to best practices and compliance standards
  • Ensure best data modelling and transformation practices
  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in cloud technologies and data engineering practices, continuously improving our data infrastructure

  • Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a Data Engineer, with a focus on building data pipelines in cloud environments
  • Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
  • Proficient in structured query languages
  • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and services, such as AWS (App Flow, S3, EC2, Glue, Lambda), Azure (Data Factory), or Google Cloud (Dataflow, BigQuery)
  • Familiarity with data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and data modeling techniques
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment

  • Exclusive access to our top-quality wines and great brands

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Us




We‚Äôre an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we‚Äôve been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world‚Äôs leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.




In the last 30 years we won several awards, including our most recent inclusion in the Forbes World's Best Management Consulting Firms report.




Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.




Our story in Portugal started in 2020 with a small office in Lisbon. The team is now over 100 across Lisbon and Porto, and we are the perfect blend of national and international collaboration and reputation.




We want to continue to grow and need people just like you!




About the Role




We are DataOps advocates and use software engineering best practices to build scalable and re-usable data solutions to help clients use their data to gain insights, drive decisions and deliver business value. Clients don‚Äôt engage BJSS to do the straightforward things, they ask us to help on their biggest challenges which means we get to work with a wide range of tools and technologies and there are always new things to learn.




BJSS data engineers are specialist software engineers that build, optimise and maintain data applications, systems and services. This role combines the discipline of software engineering with the knowledge and experience of building data solutions in order to deliver business value.




As a BJSS data engineer you‚Äôll help our clients deploy data pipelines and processes in a production-safe manner, using the latest technologies and with a DataOps culture.




You‚Äôll work in a fast moving, agile environment, within multi-disciplinary teams of highly skilled consultants, delivering modern data platforms into large organisations.




You can expect to get involved in variety of projects in the cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP), learning about and using data services such as Databricks, Data Factory, Synapse, Kafka, Redshift, Glue, Athena, BigQuery, S3, Cloud Data Fusion etc.




About You




You're an engineer at heart and enjoy the challenge of building reliable, efficient data applications systems, services and platforms.
You have a good understanding of coding best practices and design patterns and experience with code and data versioning, dependency management, code quality and optimisation, error handling, logging, monitoring, validation and alerting.
You have experience in writing well tested object-oriented python.
You have experience with using CI/CD tooling to analyse, build, test and deploy your code.
You have a good understanding of design choices for data storage and data processing, with a particular focus on cloud data services.
You have experience in using parallel computing to process large datasets and to optimise computationally intensive tasks.
You have experience in programmatically deploying, scheduling and monitoring components in a workflow.
You have experience in writing complex queries against relational and non-relational data stores.




Some of the Perks

Coverflex Flexible Benefit allowance ‚Äì you can choose to spend your allowance on pension contributions, wellbeing, gym and fitness, education, childcare and more
22 days holiday per year, plus National Bank Holidays (or a day in lieu)
An industry-leading referral scheme, with no limits on the number of referrals
Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH.
We also help you setting up your home office to make sure you‚Äôre comfortable with hybrid working
Training opportunities and incentives ‚Äì we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O‚ÄôReilly
You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
Giving back ‚Äì the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
BJSS Clubs: From trekking and paddle to books and board games, BJSS is keen on sponsoring various group activities among our employees

Title: Data Support Engineer
Description:
At ISS Tech Team we are investing in innovative and integrated technological solutions for the Facility Management Industry with a tech team headquarted in Copenhagen, Warsaw and Porto. Our Porto tech hub is the first space dedicated specifically to software development and acts as a powerhouse where our employees test and implement products for over 40,000 clients and 350,000 placemakers around the world.

Are you ready to transform the Integrated Facility Management Industry?

To become the technology leader in the Integrated Facility Management industry (FMS), we're developing digital components connected by AWS and Azure cloud solutions, we build up our machine learning models to make yet better use of our wealth of data, create predictions, and advanced AI for custom Large Language Models (LLM)!

We take care of office buildings worldwide ! These offices are increasingly equipped with technology, such as sensors and Internet of Things (IoT) devices, to support a more productive and seamless workday for employees. The purpose of our Porto innovation lab is to develop differentiating, high-quality, and scalable digital solutions for both the ISS enterprise and customers worldwide.

We implement devices all over the place to make the buildings we serve digital and friendly.

Be part of a project to make the world work better! ‚Äç

We are seeking a dedicated and skilled Data Support Engineer to join our team.

In this role, you will be mainly responsible for the operation and support of our main internal Platform for Data Ingestion, providing first and second-level support to ensure smooth and efficient data workflows are behave as expected.

Additionally, you will develop and maintain monitoring and alerting systems/dashboards to proactively identify and address potential issues.

What Will You Do


Onboarding internal stakeholders (systems) into the Platform.
Provide first and second-level support for data-related issues, ensuring timely resolution and minimal disruption to operations.
Troubleshoot and resolve data ingestion and mapping issues, working closely with development and engineering teams as needed.
Monitor and maintain the data ingestion workflow from end to end.
Low code data application development.
Perform data validation and quality checks to ensure the accuracy and integrity of data contracts.
Develop and implement monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify and address data issues.
Develop and maintain documentation for data processes, support procedures, and troubleshooting guides (with full autonomy).
Collaborate with internal teams to identify and implement improvements to data processes and workflows.
Assist in the deployment of new Ingestions and Data contracts updated.
Provide training and support to end-users on data-related systems and processes.



What Makes You a Great Fit


University Degree or an equivalent education/training.
Previous experience on a Support Role.
At least 2/3 years of experience working with Data Analysis / Mapping.
Experience with Databricks (or Spark) and/or Azure Resources in the past (Microsoft Fabric as a plus).
Comfortable with Python (Low code data application development expected, but would it be awesome for debug and spot improvments within the framework).
Knowledge/Familiarity with Monitoring strategies and Observability practices.
Structured problem solving skills.
Good communication skills in English.



Perks:


22 days of annual leave per year +3 company leave days.
Flexible working hours.
Modern, well-equipped office in the heart of Porto city.
Free parking space.
Health Insurance for you.
Hybrid working model.
Gym, snacks and drinks at the office.
Corporate events.



ISS is a Place to Be You!

Since our founding in 1901, ISS has been a people-first company. We recognize the power of diversity and celebrate the differences that make us unique. When everyone is free to be themselves, everyone benefits. Our people feel safe, respected, represented, and supported as their authentic selves, allowing them to seize opportunities and reach their full potential. We take seriously our obligation to improve lives, make a difference in our communities, and protect our planet ‚Äî because when we get things right, the world works better. And that is what drives us.

Be who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.

Become more. Become ISS.
